Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bobrashmi
Reviews.Content: I think this the best kept secret in Sydney. We were in Sydney for a vacation from the USA. It is a small hotel but in a great location(so small the taxi drivers didn't know where it was). About $40 dollar ride from the airport. Just outside the front door you can catch the free bus (number 555) and it takes right up to the Circular Quay to the Ferry station. Or you can walk 5 minutes south from the hotel to the train station. 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We were a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 kids. We had sufficient space for ourselves and sfuff. since we were on vacation we didn't spend lots of time in the room, just a place to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: danmate
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable place to stay in Sydney for a weekend visit to friends, only a 1 night stay. I've stayed in hotels all over the city & eastern suburbs and this was my first time at Pensione. It has a great location but I have no idea where they get the notion that they're a 4 star property (self-rated). The rooms are comfortable, with nice linen, good beds (we had a double - I would think that 4 star hotels have queen or king beds). The bathroom is modern & very clean but lacks any kind of space to keep your toiletries. The TV is an old style CRT on the ceiling and really not easy to watch but who comes to Sydney to sit in their room and watch TV. WIth the price of flat screen TVs nowadays I'm surprised that they have these old sets in such an awkward position. As for late check out there's no leeway at all - you want it you pay. $20 till midday and $60 for a 7pm departure. There's lovely tea in the room - 4 different flavours which we really enjoyed, and ironing facilities. They have a self service laundry instead of crazy hotel prices at most other places. Most annoying factor which is the trouble with such a location, and maybe the room we had was the club and noise until 6 am sunday morning which would keep light sleepers up. The stay all up was fine, I like the quirky signs & old building but it's more like a budget hotel where everything is extra and not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, inexpensive and clean are the only pluses”
Reviews.Author: kewlmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on Thursday 22/03/2012 out of neccessity and curiosity about this quaint hotel that I keep coming across during my online search for accommodation in Sydney CBD. I had initially planned on either the Park Regis or Ibis World Square. Online line booking was straight forward. Its website is basic and functional. Check-in was efficient and quick. Reception staff was pleasant. Corridors to the rooms are like a maze because of the (small) floor area of the building. Was assigned Room 210A which is a standard single room. It's only about 20-22 sqm size. Definitely not a room for a person with claustrophobia. Good thing I am not one. The Pensione Hotel being in an old (1950s?) building, the room has very high ceiling. This together with the dim lighting and wall colour (dull violet) makes the room interior excessively ancient and depressing. That said, the room and its adjoing bathroom are well kept and very clean. The CRT television set is mounted high above the entry door. Hence the only way to watch it without straining the neck in the very confined space of this tiny room is by lying down on the bed. The channels works intermittently drifting in and out of signals. The bed mattress is hard. Didn't have a good night sleep at all. Woke up really tired. The only other hotel I had stayed in before with comparable "hardboard" like mattress was in Shenzen, China. LOL Paid AUD$10 for in-room WiFi internet access. Signal and speed of its WiFi internet connection was excellent. Normal check-out time is 10am (rather than 12noon). For noon check-out an extra AUD$20 is charged, and which I paid for. Being conveniently located on the Chinatown end of Sydney CBD George Street makes it a good base to explore the city, be it to shop, dine or sightseeing. Checking out is also without hazzle and efficiently handled by the reception staff. Upon arriving home and checking my credit account online statement I realised they have double charged me for the 1 night stay. There were 2 charges of AUD$140 instead of just one as should be the case. I email them immediately requesting them to rectify their charging error, which at the time of writing this review (abt 8 hours after sending the email) I have yet to receive a reply from them. Not impressed at all. Eng Soh Penrith, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Clean & inexpensive, but a challenge”
Reviews.Author: Gio P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel during the Mardi Gras weekend in March on the recommendation of a student, who described it as a clean place to crash while walking Sydney. The hotel is a bit of a maze of rooms, which are distributed across a few interconnected buildings through dimly lit hallways and tired carpets. We had a superior Queen room that had been recently renovated and the rate included wifi. The room was TINY but clean and contained a ceiling mounted LCD-TV that was viewable from the bed. The bathroom was clean and functional. One can't open the curtain without sharing your room with those in the next bulding and the streetscape outside changes as one reaches the Pensione to one that is slightly more shady than other hotels we stayed in. The single pane window opened but given the curtains is not very effective. Although AC was present if you wish, it didn't seem to cool. The street noise and sirens were significant through the closed window. The reception staff was understanding when we stayed one night and decided to move to a different hotel, although we were required to pay for the 2nd night booking since it was within 24 h. Bottomline, this hotel imay be fine for student travellers, but others will need to adjust their expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Better value than most”
Reviews.Author: jugface25
Reviews.Content: First impressions as you climb the stairs to reception is that you are entering an up market backpackers. That it is not! The young reception desk staff are very welcoming, efficient and helpful. Rooms are very clean but small, although the beds are large and very comfortable. There was a very modern shower and toilet/washbasin etc. Our room was at the front of the building overlooking George Street but the double glazed soundproofing was efficient enough to keep out the hustle and bustle of the street below. The real advantage of this location is that it is within walking distance of all of the city's attractions and transport hubs. In addition the hotel has a large communal kitchen/dining area where you can prepare and eat your breakfast dinner or tea having bought the ingredients from the nearby Woolworths. There are plenty of restaurants nearby including a decent RSL Club.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: DethVeggie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the 15th feb for one night, before going on a 2 week cruise with Royal Caribbean(bet your jealous). The hotel was easy to find, close to every style of eatery, clean, and due to the double paned windows very quiet inside, even though its on a main street. For $125 a night, to find a hotel in the middle of everything, and at such good value is amazing. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Coco888
Reviews.Content: For a mid-range hotel, Pensione is located within walking distances to all amenities and entertainment. Everything is quite literally at the doorstep.This is not the Ritz Carlton, but rooms are good sized, clean and comfortable. Stay here if you ware zipping by Sydney for a couple of days and looking to save a few dollars. Staff are helpful and courteous. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: newbride4708
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Step out of the hotel, 20 mins walk on the main street and you are at Darling harbour or half an hour walk and you are at Sydney Opera house. All the time passing shops, bars and restaurants. Staff were fine, only really had contact when we checked in and checked out so had no problems. Our room was small as we expected but just what we needed really, It was clean with a massive wet room bathroom which i think may have been used for disabled customers. Spot on with location and we would stay there again. Not much of a view but was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: Owen W
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you like hot water and service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle767676
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here early feb on a monday night. we booked a deluxe double which we found to be simple and perfect for us. the room was cosy, clean and modern and the hotel had an arrival note on our bed congratulating us on our anniversary. i found this to be a thoughtful personal touch. The staff were always very polite, pleasant and professional both on the phone and at front office. Its location on George st with easy access to public transport and landmarks was great as we had planned to do many activities. We were very happy with our stay and will consider staying here again in a deluxe double. If your not looking for anything overly flash and 5* then I believe Pensione should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff,but with a few small improvements rooms would be fine”
Reviews.Author: zahnleitercollins
Reviews.Content: The staff were brilliant and consistently helpful and happy to oblige !They are the hotel finest assets. However the owners need to spend a little money to make huge improvements. !.Bedside tables and lamps 2 small shelves in bathroom near vanity 3 larger tabletop shelf near fridge Also the washing machines need to be cleaned out the reek of stale mouldy water ! There was loud duff duff music from club next door till 5am fri/sat (but that really didnt bother too much just went back to sleep. Loved the Fitness First membership pass to Park st (Great Zumba class with Jorge ) Please management sort the fore mentioned problems out and you will have a brilliant establishment

Reviews.Title: “missleading information......”
Reviews.Author: Deb I
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room to stay for 2 nights. When we arrived and were directed to our room by h friendly staff member only to walk in to a VERY Petite double which was not what i booked with a old analouge TV. When i questiond this i was told that only the more expensive rooms had LCD TVs (this only was a issue as we were going to be spending a grat deal of time in the room as i was having surgery) even though it was advertised that they all cam with lcd tvs and satalitte tv (2 channelsmusic and repeated old sitcoms) there wasent even all the free to air channels. the room was so small you could barley fit down the side of the bed which was on a diagonal it was more of s converted storage closet than anything else the only redeeming factor was the shower was EPIC!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Byron Bay, New South Wales, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Staff very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy L
Reviews.Content: Staff were very accommodating and friendly. The hotel is situated in a good location and kept very clean. The room was on the smaller side but had everything I needed and was very reasonable for the price I paid. It is now my hotel of choice for my regular trips to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel but noisy nightclub below”
Reviews.Author: AmyBugs
Reviews.Content: This is a hard review to make because I can't find fault in the hotel but I can find fault in the nightclub downstairs. The hotel itself is brilliant, really clean, gorgeous decor, helpful friendly staff, amazing location and great value for money. The one catch is the 'doof doof' music from the nightclub downstairs that made sleeping difficult. We stayed at the hotel on a Friday & Saturday night... the first night was just bearable but on the Saturday night it was worse and I could still hear the dull thud of the music even with earplugs in. To the hotel's credit, when I complained about the noise at 1.30am they spoke to the manager of the club and the music was then turned down. If you don't like to be lulled to sleep with the dulcit tones of beats in the background then this is not the hotel for you on a Friday or Saturday night. Or try requesting a room on the side of the hotel that is away from the nightclub and not fronting the street.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel with modern decor”
Reviews.Author: sexysarah23
Reviews.Content: Its an old building, done up all nice and new with a kinda of homey feel still. The room was nice and clean, a little tight for space but we didnt really spend much time in the room. Good location in the City and close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful in useful location, but not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritInAus
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticked all my boxes - cheap, clean, comfy beds and a convenient location near Darling Harbour and Chinatown, a 5 min walk from Central Station to take advantage of the airport train and 30 seconds walk from the free city circular shuttle bus. Rooms were clean and beds very comfy but a couple of tiny touches would have improved the room from average to good - somewhere to put your things in the bathroom, a lightswitch within reaching distance from the bed (no reading lamps) and extra towels supplied. Would return if the deal was good. Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't very happy, appalling room.”
Reviews.Author: JenK23
Reviews.Content: We booked because we were already booked to stay at their hotel in Melbourne and their price was pretty average. We paid $115 for a petit double so expected a very small room. We were right, it was a very small room. That's not my complaint at all. My disappointment was the scuff marks of the walls and doors. The badly done plaster repairs on the walls. The bathroom door which didn't shut properly. No bedside tables to put anything on. The toilet didn't flush properly. Curtains which don't meet properly and when you're in a room directly opposite a billboard this does matter! The room light up like day at night with the lights on the billboard. Our room looked in on the walls of the other rooms so with no net curtains you could see into everyone elses rooms. The next floor up could see down into our room and see us in bed through the gap when the curtains were shut! We only stayed one night and spent a lot of time sightseeing, we really enjoyed Sydney. It is a really good location. It is clean. There is a wifi and the building is quaint! But I was so disappointed by the room that I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: v3r4
Reviews.Content: We got a really good price for a 3-night stay, and for what we paid, we were satisfied with what we got. The hotel is clean, new (refurbished) and modern. And the location is fantastic; right on George St in Haymarket. We were on a food trip, so we wanted to be in the city, but as close to Surry Hills as possible. The elevators were the cause of mild annoyance, as the swipe card reader doesn't work properly - there's a special way of putting the swipe card in to activate it. SERVICE: As another reviewer also mentioned; service at reception can be slow, as there was only one staff on duty at a time from what we observed. BEDROOM: We stayed in the Petite Double and it really is small and petite! The size of the bedroom didn't bother me at all, but the view from our window faced the other hotel rooms. My gripe with this is that they only have black-out curtains in the room; perhaps have two sets of curtains? One to keep light out, and the other to allow light in but with privacy. BATHROOM: Bathroom was small, but great water pressure in the shower. Gripe #1: As the shower area was higher than the bathroom floor, and there was only a half-shower screen, water kept flowing out and pooling in the bathroom floor, out of the shower area. Gripe #2: There weren't any exhaust fans in the bathroom (unless i didn't see the switch for it). There was a vent, but no fan. A small shower/toilet without a fan/window is no fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HereAreMyThoughts
Reviews.Content: While visiting my brother and sister-in-law in Melbourne, we decided to visit Sydney for four days/three nights the first week in December. Trying to find a reasonably priced room with a double and single bed (as opposed to bunked beds or a pullout couch) proved to be harder than I expected (esp. since two queens tend to be almost standard in the States). I conducted an extensive search and eventually found the Pensione Hotel Sydney on George Street. We could not have been happier with our selection. The hotel is in a prime location within Sydneyâ€™s Chinatown district. If you are walkers (as we are), you are within a 15-30 minute walk to all key locations, including Sydney Harbor, Darling Harbor, museums, great shopping and places to eat. Should you prefer to take public transportation, the hotelâ€™s location could not be more convenient, with more than ten city buses (including the free 555 city shuttle bus) stopping outside the main entrance and taxi stands on the corners of the block. The front entrance is unassuming (you can practically walk right by it if you are not looking for it), but do not let that fool you. While I had prepared myself for a small room, it was very clean and very comfortable, even for three adults. Additionally, the bathrooms were very nice with amazing water pressure, a lovely shower and great smelling toiletries. Finally, I cannot say enough about the staff at the Pensione. From our first phone conversations when booking with Lauren, to each and every employee we encountered, they went out of their way to make us feel welcomed, while providing great local information and recommendations. After our stay at the Penisone Hotel Sydney on George Street, I would not only stay at another Penisone or one of their sister hotels part of the 8 Hotels chain, but highly recommend it to friends and family visiting. Some â€œinsiderâ€� Sydney travel tips (all walking distance from the hotel): â€¢ Stop by Chinatown and try the Emperorâ€™s cream puffs â€“ they are $.30/AUS each (but go for the full dozen). They are like bite-sized heaven in your mouth! â€¢ If you like food courts, you will be in heaven in Sydney! Make sure to check out the one under Meyers and the ones in Chinatown. â€¢ The Hay Street market is around the corner from the hotel (when you go out the back entrance), this is a great location to get gifts for people at great rates. It is a little more â€œtouristyâ€� than other markets, but you can get great deals if you know what you are looking for. â€¢ If you are heading to Darling Harbor one night to see the fireworks, get a table outside at the Watershed (a place recommended by the front desk at the Pensione) and enjoy good food and a front row seat!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE for MONEY”
Reviews.Author: banteng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pensione Hotel for one night only (2/12) to attend a wedding in China Town, which was only a 2 minute walk away. It was a last minute booking as Sydney CBD Hotels were almost totally booked out due to a number of functions. 'Anywhere we can just put our heads down' we thought; oh that one will be OK then. OK? what a lovely surprise! So handy to many of Sydney's attractions, genuine & friendly staff only too eager to help, spotlessly clean & functional rooms, morning paper, non smoking which is just fantastic, tea & coffee, bar fridge. Only one small criticsm is that they could fit a shower curtain maybe. The hotel has any number of small eateries & coffee shops within a 3 minute walk, handy to Central Railway Station, The Capitol Theatre is also only a 2 minute walk & 5 minutes to the Entertainment Centre. Look, this is not the Park Royal or The Hilton etc however it is not 500 plus dollars a night either! This hotel fills a niche market of good clean accommodation, that is central to so many attractions, clean & comfortable rooms with Staff that are friendly, genuine, treat you with empathy, maintain your self esteem & at all times have a refreshing & welcoming smile. Value for money & in the heart of Sydney, if you knock this sweet & appealing little Hotel, you must be too hard to please. To the Management & Staff of the Pensione Hotel from these Wollongong guests.......all of you take a well deserved bow! many thanks & kind regards Les & Bernadette Wilson

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced convenient hotel in Haymarket”
Reviews.Author: trigirl2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pensione Hotel for 4 nights a few weeks apart during a recent overseas trip to Australia. For both stays, we were on the top floor (4th) in a deluxe queen room. The rooms were recently refurbished and extremely clean. My main concern in travelling for several weeks was to not bring bed-bugs back to my home and there was no evidence of this at all at Pensione. The size of the rooms are cozy but considering the reasonable price-point for both stays, this wasn't any sort of issue since we were on our honeymoon anyway! The noise level at the top floor was fairly low and the bed was quite comfortable. The hotel is on a busy street and well-located. You can walk quite easily to Darling Harbour or grab a bus/train to different parts of Sydney. A couple of small cons: There isn't a shower curtain in the shower and although we loved the lovely shower head and water pressure, water went everywhere during our showers. It made for a bit of a mess. Also, during the 2nd stay, we had major troubles with wifi; however, it was likely due to a low signal level and this issue may vary depending on the strength of your wireless card. Overall, however, we wouldn't hesitate to stay at Pensione again on our next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and priced well for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: barbante
Reviews.Content: This position is so convenient. We stayed three nights when we went to see KD Lang concert. Close to Central railway station, George Street buses, Paddy's market, light rail and Chinatown. Our room was extremely clean, non smoking and no smell of cigarettes, we had two pillows each without having to ask. Bed comfortable and night time quiet. They supplied hair dryer, iron and board, coffe and tea making facilities, fridge and safe and all toiletries yet the room was so small any luggage larger than carry on would hardly fit on the floor. Bathroom in comparison was a good size also very clean. We had to push the bed to be able to walk around the end between the desk. Admittedly our room was booked as petite double. Definitely petite. We were told we were upgraded, I'd hate to see what we originally had. Reception staff friendly and hospitable. A few steps up off the street to elevator up to reception on 1st floor. An elevator a back of building to upper floors. A bit of a rabbit warren, building looks like it is a renovation, not new.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a great locaton”
Reviews.Author: andytseng
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed there for 2 nights during my birthday weekend in Sydney. We booked it about 2 weeks in advance and got a 2-night "Deluxe Room" for $300 which isn't too bad considering its location. The hotel reception is on 1st floor which is slightly different than the usual. We were made to wait for almost 20 mins before speaking to the front-desk staff as she was on the phone with another customer and there was no one else around. To be fair, it's really not her fault as she was trying to help the customer on the phone with his/her booking and I don't think that customer realised that there's only one staff then. Having said that, it would be nice if there were more staffs to assist the customers onsite. As some of the previous reviews have suggested, our 3-floor "Deluxe Room" isn't big (enough room for our two carry-on luggages and there's also a single sofa by the side) but it's tidy and recently refurbished and I like the colour and design of it. The bed is clean and comfortable (which is the most important thing I look for in a hotel anyway) and the bathroom is okay (basic but in good and clean condition). During our weekend stay there, we didn't hear any noise at all even though out room faces the main George Street. The staffs are helpful and the free wifi there was handy also. There's also a Guest Lounge Area with a kitchenette at the back of the first floor to hang out with other people. The free '555' CBD Shuttle is only 5-10mins walk away and will take you all the way to Circular Quay where Sydney Opera House, Darling Harbour, Harbour Bridge and most of attractions are located (Queen Victoria Building is also only a 10mins walk on the same street too if you fancy doing a spot of shopping there). Please note, the free shuttle does get full fairly quickly though. The Central Railway Station is 15mins walk away and has regular trains (every 10mins) departing for the Airport (10mins journey). All in all, it's in good location and good value for the money if you don't mind the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: supatrippa
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one weekend night to attend the KPop music festival at ANZ Stadium. The hotel was very easy to find and the small room size (we had a petite and shared a bed) wasn't a shock as I had read many reviews and knew what to expect. The room and bathroom were very clean and functional, lovely shower! Really handy to public transport, we used trains and is was less than a 5 minute walk to Central Station. We felt safe returning to the hotel late at night after the show. Finding the reception on arrival was the only difficulty that we had, even though we knew it was on the first floor, a staff member pointed us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good value”
Reviews.Author: gary_auck_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights here in Nov 2011. The front desk was warm and friendly. A very good start. Check in was a breeze. The room was of good size ( we stayed in the deluxe room ). There was a narrow wardrobe and inside the wardrobe was a small bar fridge and below the bar fridge was a safe box. The room was well lit with 3 lamps in total on top of the ceiling lighting. Room was modern and furnishings were contemporary and tasteful. The bathroom/toilet for our toilet was meant for a disabled person so it was very big. Lighting again was good. Mirror was big. Good water pressure and hot water was quick to come on when we needed it. However, the basin was a bit too small for our liking. The room was quiet as our room was to the back of the hotel on the 3rd floor. The location of the hotel is fantastic! Right smack on George St where almost everything is in the CBD! Bus stop almost literally just outside the door step. Close walk to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. Unfortunately, Wifi is not free and is charged at $10 for 3 hrs. Probably this is the reason why it is not 5 stars from me. In this day and age, Wifi should be free to guests and not be a premium on top of the room charge (that's my opinion anyway). Maybe Pensione can think of free Wifi that's capped at, say, 50mb a day for hotel guests? During checkout, the front desk even asked if I have transportation arranged and if I had my shuttle ticket printed out in advance. A very nice touch I have to say. Kudos to the whole team at Pensione. We will definitely stay here again if we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel on a very busy road”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottingMan
Reviews.Content: This is a very conveniently located hotel in downtown Sydney, a 5 minute walk from Darling Harbour and a short bus ride from Circular Quay (bus stop is only about 50 feet from the front of the hotel. Lots of restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops and a pharmacy within 2-3 minutes walk (including a FANTASTIC French cafe on the corner of the next intersection up from the hotel). We arrived by car at night, and the one-way street it's on is VERY busy--no place to park, even temporarily to check in. So we just threw on our hazard/parking lights and prayed for the best as other cars and buses swerved around us. There's no parking onsite, but they do have two options--one just a block away in a public garage and one that was further away (but cheaper). WARNING! If you choose the public garage that's close by, it is not a 24-hour garage--it closes at some reasonable hour (not sure when, probably 10 or 11pm) and doesn't open until some reasonable hour (I think it was 7am). That's very important if, like us, you have an early morning flight and need to be at the airport well before 7am. Fortunately the staff at the front desk were VERY good and pointed that out to us, so we got the car out before going to bed, parked it on a side street 2 blocks away overnight, and then got out of there so early we didn't have to plug any parking meters. Can't say enough about the whole reception staff, in fact....between asking enough questions to figure out the garage thing to getting online to check us in for our flight--and then the usual task of giving directions--they were great! Rooms are fairly standard, not too big, not too small. Our room (#406) faced a courtyard which was probably good from a noise standpoint (remember what I said about being on a very busy street), but it wasn't real great for scenery. Odd, as well, was the fact that our window was completely plexiglassed in. No way to open the window--because you could see the handle, but couldn't get to it because it was behind the plexiglass. Shower was nice, bed was OK....air conditioning worked fine (which you needed because the window wouldn't open). Front of the hotel doesn't inspire you to believe it's going to be nice (especially not with the horrid smelling wino sitting on the steps when we arrived), but they have done a nice job making it clean and tidy and updated on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, simple but very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: saraquails
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pensione in Sydney and I was quite satisfied by my choice. The location is very good, within walking distance (15 minutes) from either Circular Quai or Darling Harbour, and with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The hotel is clean and reasonably well kept and the reception staff is very helpful and kind. The room I booked was a standard and was very basic and tiny, but very clean, and so was the bathroom. I know they do have deluxe room so maybe those are a bit easier on the eye! I would recommend this hotel to someone who doesn't want to pay too much and just want to have a clean place to stay in a central position!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bendalong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a very early flight. The room was tiny and spotlessly clean. This is not a hotel I would recommend staying in for more than a night or two as the cheaper rooms are very small. But this is what we paid for. A clean and comfortable and very convenient hotel. Will be staying again if I need to stay in the city for a night. Staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: verity a
Reviews.Content: i would say its the number one hotel in sydney city...... wonderful beautiful staff , so clean and comfortable staying. the staff are helpful to your needs when requested it was an amazing stay can t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central City Hotel with respectable value”
Reviews.Author: Aceeker
Reviews.Content: The building was a bit aged, but the hotel was fairly well kept up. Good location near central Sydney - within walking distance of the university, and not too far from the bay area where the Sydney Opera House is located.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights when across for a conference. Hotel room was small, which I knew and expected from previous reviews, but very clean, well appointed with a great (but small) bathroom. Exactly what I was looking for. I was only at the hotel to sleep, and this hotel was a very nice surprise. Certainly not 5 star but way more than adeqaute for my needs. Will definitely stay here again. For the money it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Stylish69
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, never before have I experienced such great service. This little hidden jewel with amazing modern rooms and better than 5 star service. I have travelled all around Australia and this was my most enjoyable stay, thank you to all the team who spent numerous hours on the phone looking for my luggage. This place is one not to miss when staying in Sydney, unbeatable location, super clean rooms, service and well priced. I will be back without a doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: jayjay41
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel for two nights. Found the room a good size, clean and tidy. Big bathroom with an amazing shower, like standing in a rain downpour- nice. Great location. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “best in the area for the money”
Reviews.Author: QUEEN_OF_CATS
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights in july, paid $25 a night to upgrade to a delux room . from what i have been told well worth it. it gave us a bigger room, (as the basic rooms are very small) and nicer furnishings. we had zippered king singles for our bed and it was massive and super comfy as were the pillows. bathroom small and bathroom floor got soaked everytime the shower was on. our room was on the 4th floor over looking george st , we could hardly hear the traffic outside as the windows are double glazed. good nights sleep both nights. i used the guest lounge on the friday night , took a bottle of wine in there and sat and listen to the music in the bar downstairs since the rest of my party had gone to bed. it is cold in there tho as the room is not closable, open stairwell to bar downstairs. it was equiped with a microwave, crockery , cutlery , payable internet and a laundry. no restaurant on site didnt bother us at all being in the heart of china town. location excellent , for us you cant beat it.george st one side china town the other.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell And I Will Not Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Arcturus6
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying the Hotel Staff were very nice and friendly. I feel bad for them that the hotel is not. This hotel has a three star raiting and does not deserve three stars. One star would be a generoud rating. The rooms are small and offer little amenities. We did have a small mini fridge, a safe (where I had to actually lay flat on the floor to reach) a hair dryer, an iron and ironing board. Golly, gee whiz and wow! During my stay there we had two "false fire alarms" requiring those in the hotel to evacuate!. There is no ice machine at all in the hotel and there was only two elevators, one in front and one in the back. The bathrooms were equipped with showers only and they were not enclosed so water went everywhere when taking a shower! In addition there is very little space for keeping toiletries. Also, I supposedly had one of the better rooms and had to pay an additional $15AU nightly for that privilege! The closet in my room was very small and reminded me of something you would keep a couple of brooms in. All in all, I cannot recommend this hotel unless someone wants to be punished for taking a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MarcusBVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for 3 nights to have a Sydney break and see a show. The trip and hotel was booked as a surprise gift so I can't comment on the value/cost but what I can say was that we were treated like VIPs and that everything was perfect. Yes the room is small but we were there to see the city , not to have a room party! You could not ask for a better location, 5 min walk to the Central train Station and 15 minutes to Circular Quay or a free bus outside. I had a business motto that was "We aim to exceed your expectations". Well they did that admirably.

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect for Mary Poppins”
Reviews.Author: jaybee1965
Reviews.Content: I booked a family room at this hotel for Saturday night 6th August to see Mary Poppins at the Capitol Theatre. My parents, brother and 15 year old son shared a room with a double, two single beds and a bunk bed. A small fridge and tea/coffee facilities were provided. The window was double glazed and we didn't hear any noise although we overlooked George Street on level 2. It was a very short walk to Campbell Street and the Capitol Theatre, as well as Chinatown, Paddy's Markets and Central Railway Station. The lady at Reception was very friendly and offered to store our bags when we checked out as we were catching a bus home at 1pm. Old building but nicely renovated inside, modern bathroom with luxurious cloudburst type shower. It suited us to all be in one room as we were only sleeping overnight and thought $300 was a good price for the excellent location. The reception is on the first floor so the most obvious street frontage is Charlie Chans Bar. There is also a security coded front door for night access.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: lee0170
Reviews.Content: We really like this small hotel in China town Sydney on George Street. The hotel was 20 mins walk to harbour bridge and very pleasant to stay in. We did have a uncomfortable and the lovely receptionist swapped the bed over with no hassle at all. I have to commend the girl on reception (August 2011) she was very professional and freindly and she had superb knowledge of the area, and give us grat advice. The rooms were tastefully decorated but a little bit small but you understand that being in the middle of a city. will definately go back there when in Sydney next.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: cee99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pensione hotel before and loved it, however this time it was not quite so enjoyable. On both occasions I was travelling solo. The room was small, however this is an old building and it was perfectly acceptable to me on my own (and I am quite large). My room had an en suite bathroom with (most) toiletries, fridge, tv with remote and wardrobe + iron and hair dryer. It was beautifully clean and comfortable and it is in a fantastic location for the price. My main qualms were: 1. I wasn't provided with a hand soap (although this was just an oversight and was quickly rectified) 2. My toilet began leaking very loudly at about 4.30am. The reception is 24hours, but when I went there was no one there. I managed to fix the leaking myself 3. The bar next door played very loud, not very good music until about 5.30am on Saturday - I was on the first floor at the front of the hotel (on George St) (There was no noise on Sunday night) Overall this is a great hotel, good location, spotless and friendly staff. If you are staying just be aware of the room size and ask to stay in the back of the building or on a higher floor where it should be quieter

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location...”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lizzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Really liked the location and the fact that you can hop onto the free city shuttle bus. Food aplenty ranging from Chinese, Kebabs & Doners, Bakeries, Japanese, Korean; all right at the doorstep. The room was small, in fact I felt that the bathroom was bigger than the bedroom. I didn't mind the room being small but it gave a crick in my neck having to look up at the TV that was mounted at the top left corner (just above the door). Always ask first if Internet is free. I thought I saw a banner on the website saying internet is free but apparently it wasn't. Perhaps if you take a more expensive room (I took Deluxe Single) they might give it to you FOC and allow you late checkout (normal checkout time 10.00 am). I love that the staff were showing good ol' Aussie hospitality. The staff were friendly, helpful and has a handy map for you at the counter. If I ever come to Sydney, I would want to stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and clean right in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: bubblycanary
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right in the heart of Sydney CBD. There's a bus stop right in front of the hotel. Convenient location. Darling Harbour is just 10-15 minutes walk away. The hotel room is small but very comfortable, clean, & nicely decorated. Thanks to their double-paned windows, we don't have any troubles with the noise from the buzzing George street. There's a common kitchen area that guests can cook and dine if they feel like to but if not then restaurants are just everywhere around the corner!.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and facilities albeit with a freshly painted smell”
Reviews.Author: trailswest2008
Reviews.Content: Had four excellent days at this middle range Sydney Hotel very close to city centre. Small items fixed immediately in my room, very helpful staff and location on noisy/ busy George Street is counteracted by double windows. Added bonus is free Fitness First Voucher each day - two centres short walking distance and very welcoming. Good laundry facility but needs to be spotless at all times - uses Dollar coins. Room had pillar immediately in entrance area and no table but otherwise excellent. Recommended - rate good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Letsgobronco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pensione on the recommendation of the concierge desk at Sydney International Airport as a last minute booking when experiencing flight delays due to the Chile volcanic ash. We were pleasantly surprised with the price, and even more so to receive an unsolicited upgrade upon arrival. The staff were friendly and efficient, rooms pleasant with double glazed windows for noise reduction, and the hotel is centrally located to China Town, Paddys Market and Darling Harbour. There is also a communal kitchen for guest use. The only cons - perhaps a small table and chairs would be a useful addition to the room, and it was a little confusing to find reception after being dropped by the shuttle bus at the rear of the hotel ardade. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy499659
Reviews.Content: My mother and sister and I stayed for 7 nights, sharing a room in June 2011. The service / knowledge / recommendations and friendliness of the staff (especially Jess) was great - we tried many of her restaurant suggestions and were not dissapointed. The room was clean and comfortable - not ultra flash, but with all the facilities you need at a reasonable price. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance to paddys markets, central station, Darling harbour, Powerhouse museum, Capitol theatre,etc etc. We liked best the friendliness and helpfullness of the staff and the great location. The only thing we didn't like was the sirens that woke us up occasionally at night - but if you sleep in one of the busiest streets in Sydney, you have to expect that ! I would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a clean, reasonably priced hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to Public Transport.. and nothing else really”
Reviews.Author: casey9759949
Reviews.Content: If you are going to rely on public buses and trains to get to your places everyday, this will be a perfect place for you to stay. In fact, food around this area is considerably good as you will have a very good variety and you will never be bored with just burgers and chips. I spent about 5 days there and at night you will get the strange feeling of staying at a budget red light district in Geylang (a similar place back in where I came from... go google it)... and oh yes, minus the free wireless connection of course.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to rest and shelter from the Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: kennvee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pensione for two nights at the end of April 2011. I am motivated to write a review simply because my expectations of the hotel from online reading were exceeded. Most notably, thanks to double glazed windows, the noise from George Street did not interfere with my rest and enjoyment of the place. In addition the Pensione has location, location, location. It is close to the Sydney Entertainment Centre (my destination), the Sydney CBD and the Town Hall railway station. The staff were very helpful providing information with their knowledge of the locality. I would recommend the Pensione to a friend and I would definitely book there again on my next visit to the Sydney CBD Be prepared for a fairly small room without comfortable chairs. That doesn't matter if you are busy all day and only want to sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brenswee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pensione for a couple nights my first few days in Sydney and was overall really happy with it. The location is fantastic!! It's close to the Central and Town Hall train stations, and my first day I even walked all the way up to Circular Quay, which was about a 30 minute walk. They upgraded my room without me even asking-- it was nice and clean and looked fairly recently renovated. It was a little dark in the room, but nothing a lamp couldn't fix. The hotel felt secure (they lock the doors at night and you need a code to get in), which I really appreciated given that I was travelling alone, and they also had really fairly priced internet. The staff were extremely friendly and seemed to want to do anything they could to ensure I had a great stay. The only thing I wished had been different was that my room was situated right off the reception area, so I was woken up at 5am the 1st morning by other visitors checking in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Small bed and room, but manageable”
Reviews.Author: NishiNippon
Reviews.Content: Location is right next to Chinatown, close to Paddy's Markets. Possible to walk from Central Station to the hotel. The room was tiny and the bed was a bit small, but if you are looking for a place to sleep that is close to Chinatown then this hotel is not a bad choice. Television is placed at a weird angle and the view is not really anything to talk about. You wouldn't stay in the room for long. Check in and check out was painless and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: N1C0LA
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney from Perth for a few days with my sister and we stayed at the Pensione Hotel. It is really close to China Town, and it takes less than 5 minutes to walk to Town Hall station, and not much longer to get to Darling Harbour. The hotel itself had helpful staff, and the deluxe twin room was a nice clean, modern room which also had a fridge which was handy. There is a small but very useful communal kitchen and lounge on 1st floor, as well as a washer & dryer, there was never really anyone in there when we wanted to use it to make toast in the morning and pack up some sandwiches for the day ahead. There seemed to be a good mixture of people staying at the hotel such as families, older couples, and younger travellers too. We never had a problem with noise or anything, and found the rooms very comfortable - it was nice to get a newspaper in the morning as well :) I am booking the pensione hotel again for my parents who will be visitting Sydney, as my sister and I loved the location and had a very comfortable, enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and convenient, that's it.”
Reviews.Author: katsui
Reviews.Content: Service: Good. The lady even helped get a huntsman spider out of our room. The room: Basic. We were upgraded, I'm not sure if I like that, we ended up with a double bed and a bunkbed? Why did we need a bunkbed? The TV was awkwardly positioned above the double bed so the best place to watch TV was from the top bunk. Location: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. Close by to everything. Amenities: Don't expect much. What I liked the best: Location, cheap. What I liked the least: Everything else. I won't be coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Not too sure what the negativity is about”
Reviews.Author: deathdude12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe double, im aware there are smaller rooms, however had no problems with anything really. Internet would be good if it was free, i had my own wireless so i used that. The hotel itself was rather unique in its layout, very good location. The main lift is a little slow but the building is 'old' ( for sydney). The facilities were your average ones really, laundry which worked fine, it has a nice little kitchen/communal area which was handy. Well recommend this hotel if your thinking of visiting, within 5 minutes walk of central station, tram stop, monorail stop and sydney tower.

Reviews.Title: “good value but could be noisy”
Reviews.Author: franki53
Reviews.Content: The staff made this little hotel in the heart of george street (some 25 mins walk from opera house) all worth while Was upgrade from a back packer hostel but very central for all our needs 10 seconds from pubs, internet cafes, cafes, buses, food shops, markets and 10 mins or so from attractions Smallish room but adequate Smoking area good but needed bit more sun as very shady Had a launderette and cooking facilities I advice a room on level 4 as we where under a club/pub and on friday and saturdays it was very noisy

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel in a quiet position near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: kenfrew
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very comfortable and clean, although a bit small. There was a kitchen area on the next floor where you could make breakfast or a meal but we ate out as there were lots of restaurants to choose from in nearby Darling Harbour. There wasn't a bar in the hotel or lounge area but there was a nice bar just next door. Good value hotel in quite a central position.

Reviews.Title: “Looks better in the ads, than in real life”
Reviews.Author: travelexpert11
Reviews.Content: Although it is in an ideal location with easy accessibility around the city - the hotel itself is not very clean looking from the outside and even once inside. Our hotel room window was so small you could hardly see out, so no natural light came in at all. The corridors were very dark and musty smelling and the smell of cigarettes from the outside smoking area was awful as you had to use this entrance to get to your room. The reception area could also do with a refurbish. Staff were very helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SaraD_11
Reviews.Content: I found the service fantastic. The reception staff were exceptionally helpful. The location was perfect for my needs. Everything was in walking distance. I didn't need to catch a cab anywhere. Although the room was small, it was clean and contemporary. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a city centre location”
Reviews.Author: wirralpam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the end of our holiday in Oz. Staff were very helpful and friendly and hotel was really clean which is so important. We knew the room was compact when we booked but it had everything we needed so no complaints there. Great location but a bit too busy for me but that is just a personal thing. Husband slept well but the air con units outside on the roof kept me awake but I am a very light sleeper so most things keep me awake anyway. The fire alarm works really well as we found out on our last night. Had to evacuate the building at 1.40 a.m. due to some idiot deciding to take a 40 minute shower and setting the alarm off. Had it been the real thing, I can assure you nobody would sleep through that alarm! All in all a very good hotel and I would recommend it to anyone wanting the city centre. You can also cook in their guest lounge. There are laundry facilities so you can self cater if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, central”
Reviews.Author: ST_ray_BJ
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at Pensione but I've been to Sydney several times for work. After comparing prices and location, I decided to try the Pensione again and wondered if it had gone drab and old in the years since my last stay. On the contrary, it was as clean and well-kept as the last time, and front desk staff were nice and helpful. I had a petite double deluxe (double bed in a small room, cheaper than the premium). While there was no wardrobe, there were hooks and hangers on the wall, which was fine for a weekend meeting or if you're travelling out of a suitcase. Fridge, kettle / tea / coffee making things, great bed, nice toiletries were all in the room. Bathroom was spotless and rainshower great -- there weren't even mould spots in the shower stall. It's a perfect base for exploring the city, and walking back alone from the lightrail station late at night was fine, it's a busy area and safe. I think if you need a bigger room or space, the larger premium rooms are also great value but presumably that's why they tend to be booked up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: GigiNine
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget choice for Sydney CBD. It's near the corner of Goulburn and George Sts, very close to Chinatown. A bit of hike from the central CBD and the harbour. Well served for public transport with a bus stop right outside (don't forget to get a bus pass from a newsagent, you can't pay cash on Sydney buses). It's not that far to Town Hall station. Visitors to Sydney may find the area a little dodgy feeling - but it really is quite safe, though I would be careful walking around late at night, like in all cities. There is a Coles grocery store across the road. Make sure to ask for a quiet room - there are a lot of internal facing rooms for less noise (I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet my room was) There are more rooms than are evident from the street frontage, hidden in a maze of corridors, some with steps, so perhaps not ideal for the disabled. I stayed in a Petite Double, which is very petite ! But there are high ceilings so it feels OK - it's fitted out with a queen bed, a chest of draws and a bar fridge. There are no cupboards (so no ironing board or iron in the room, they do have a separate laundry though) - just hooks on the wall. There is no seating and the TV hangs from the ceiling. They have cable tv - BBC news, V, espn, Arena - but don't have any of the digital channels or SBS. My room was a little tired - some paint is peeling from the walls. The lighting is rather poor - very dim. It was difficult to read as there were also no reading lamps (I find this is a problem in many hotels, I guess it must save on electricity costs) The room is airconditioned - not adjustable, you're stuck on 20o which was not quite cool enough as it was very muggy weather when I stayed. There were 2 very big (if grubby) windows which you could open (mine looked over a lightwell onto a roof, had to keep the curtain shut for privacy). The bed is a little saggy, and the decor is a bit tired (or is it just the drap colour scheme?). The bathroom is really lovely - clean and new, with a good shower (good water pressure and hot water!) but like the room, poorly thought out. The toilet gets soaked when you are having a shower, as they placed the entry at the wrong end! The hotel has a nice shared lounge space with a tiny kitchen (eg microwave and sink) and a laundry. They have an arrangement for free entry to a Fitness First gym nearby (which is a much better option than an in-house gym which are often tiny and poorly equipped). I would stay here again - this could be a really nice hotel with a little work.

Reviews.Title: “My precious necklace "disappeared"”
Reviews.Author: sandra_wright
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for a single night in January because the hotel we were staying in didn't have a room for one of the nights we needed - and it was the biggest mistake I've EVER made. The room was very basic but OK, despite only having a view of the a/c units through very grimy windows The main issue was that we were a bit rushed when we checked out because we only just made the 10am check out deadline and I left my favourite necklace behind in the room. I realised in the taxi on the way back to our original hotel that I'd forgotten to put it on and immediately rang reception to ask if someone could retrieve it. The person on Reception was very sympathetic and said it hadn't been handed in but that she'd check with housekeeping. She rang back very quickly to say that she'd asked them to check but that it wasn't in the room. My husband explained that I had definitely left it there because I only ever take it off to go to bed - it has great sentimental value for me, although it wasn't a valuable piece of jewellery per se - but a further search apparently failed to find it. Despite several phone calls that day and the following couple of days it never did turn up, which upset me a great deal because I KNOW I left it behind in the room and we rang the hotel very soon after we left, and certainly before any other guest had checked into that room. The girl on Reception was very helpful and sympathetic but that didn't help me retrieve my precious necklace. The saddest thing about al of this is that it ruined my entire trip to Sydney and it's now the only vivid memory I have of my time in Australia. Please be careful if you stay here that you lock everything away when you're not in the room and that you make sure you take everything with you when you leave so that you don't have the same experience as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location - worth upgrading!”
Reviews.Author: Jovizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Premium Double which was definately worth the extra cost! Situated on the third floor towards the back of the building so we experienced no road/pub noise, the room was very spacious (which is essential when on a lengthy holiday around Australia with lots of luggage) and the decor was very contemporary which suited our style. Very large bathroom and shower, very big and comfy bed. In room safety deposit box, and the onsite laundry was a bonus too! Our only minor complaint about our room was the lack of drawers/shelves for storage, there was only a small wardrobe space. We had relatives staying in a Premium Petite Double too which was decorated in the same contemporary style but much smaller (although still had a huge bathroom/shower) so wouldn't recommend for travellers with lots of luggage - luckily our relatives are from Oz so only had small cases for their 3 night stay. Standard rooms did not appear to be decorated in the same style, a bit more basic, but communal areas were all styled well. You have to access the hotel via a doorway entrance on George Street, reception is on the first floor, we never had a problem with the lifts during our 5 night stay. The location of the hotel is fairly central, China Town on your doorstep, with lots of buses running up and down George Street - including the rare 555 free shuttle bus to the harbour! Town Hall underground station is only a short walk away, and is takes approx 15/20 minutes to walk up to the harbour with lots of shops on the way. A taxi up to the Harbour/Rocks was only 9 dollars. Darling Harbour is also within 10 mins walking distance. My only negative about the location was some of the 'adult' book shops close by on George Street, but don't let that put you off as we still felt it was a safe area and always busy. There is a fabulous little deli/cafe just up from the hotel on the corner of George Street/Goulburn Street that is great for breakfast and sandwiches, and seems to be open practically all day and is always busy! There's also a great little bottle shop next door. So unless you have the budget to stay up at one of the lush hotels on the harbour, Pensione was in a very good central location at a reasonable rate for someone on a month long holiday, and the room was spacious, clean and stylishly decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Newtraveller009
Reviews.Content: We had booked a trip to Sydney earlier in the year and left our accommodation to the last minute. After days of searching for the cheap accommodation in Sydney over the New Year period I stumbled across Pensione Hotel. Every one I spoke to at Pensione to assist with my booking were so helpful. Initially I had booked a petite double but decided to upgrade to a premium double. My expectations of it being small and not very nice were changed the minute we arrived. Our room was so tidy, modern and big. We were so pleased with the service, the value for money, the location of our room and everything about Pensione. I would recommend discussing your requirements with the staff when booking as if you need a bigger room get a bigger room but if you want something cheap and cheery go for a smaller room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: andiluciad
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We stayed in premium room, I guess they have been refurbished recently. Staff very friendly, they made good recommendations and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl36
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room. The room was nothing special,it was small, dark, the painting was coming off the wall in some parts, and this is the hotel which calls itself a stylish boutique hotel !!!! Also there was not much furniture to put away your belongings. We had to change room half way because of the noise level from the bar downstairs. The second room was even smaller, with not even a bedside table, lamp, or chest of drawers. We asked for those items and we were only given a lamp (taken another room). We only realized half way through that there were cooking facilities available, and a guest lounge room. When we checked in ,although the service was very good, this was never mentioned clearly. On the whole though the staff was very helpful and friendly. The $99 rate , a catchy price, is almost never applicable. And what we paid for New Year period is definitely not justified.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: karlandlisa1009
Reviews.Content: Booked on line for one night.The hotel is in a great location,close to city, bars,restaurants.Clean rooms and friendly staff.The young lady on reception was very helpfull and made us feel very welcome.Rooms were spacious and clean.This is a well managed hotel and i would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a bargain,for which it is.The only downside..............we stayed for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “website looks can deceive”
Reviews.Author: syko2
Reviews.Content: $160 a night mightn't be top-dollar, but it ain't chicken-feed either. for similar money, I've stayed in much worse hotels, but much better ones too. a quaintly-named 'petite double' isn't so much petite, as oddly-shaped and badly-planned. the smart design and marketing of this hotel and its sisters & brothers couldn't be better reflected than on the slick-as website/s, precisely why in-the-flesh first impressions come as such a disappointment: the sydney pensione is like a pathetic shadow of its apparent former glory; such a shame for something that shows such promise (and in a heritage building to boot). the only real saving grace is a group of lightweight, junior but warm, friendly, unpretentious front desk staff. the location is advantageous (it's a case of chinatown, you're virtually standing in it, for example) and the guest lounge is a cool feature, 'though that too is as tatty as the peeling paint and carpets that look like they're about to walk out on their own which feature throughout. rooms have lousy, well out-of-date tvs that don't get digital channels and there were none of the touted in-house or cable movies. there are hangers, but nowhere to hang them. no bedside or any other kind of tables, not a chair. our shower-screen required the strength of the governator to slide and, despite repeated pledges, was never fixed. let's face it, the room shouldn't have been made available unless and until it was functional, in the first place. housekeeping didn't so much as bother to wipe the bathroom mirror, or other surfaces, wash a dirty glass or replace toiletries and it took till late in the day to service the room in any case (except on our day of departure, when we had the luxury of a late checkout, which was respected with an early knock on the door from said slackers). the bed was very roughly made. if the hotel met expectations raised by the website, it would be a very different story. not much point, it seems to me, having a quality website if you don't deliver the hotel to match. for not very much more money, one can get a better-located hotel with many more features and a much higher standard of presentation. deeply disappointing : (

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great value for money in Sydney's CBD”
Reviews.Author: RossMon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Sydney Pensione quite a few times, and have always been glad I've stayed there. Clients regularly put me in nearby hotels costing three-fives times the price of the Pension, and I always sleep better here. Comfortable beds, and usually quite - but of course it's in the CBD, so some noise is expected. Because it's budget priced, other guests, particularly groups, can be noisey in the hall, but again, all things considered, great value for money. If you want a luxury room (and you'll pay $$$ in Sydney's CBD) go somewhere else, but if you want clean, modern, budget accommodation in a great location, check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean. A good step above hostel, but don't get a room above the bar on George Street.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeaucoup
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel, but not boutique as it is described. The rooms are small, but adequate. Ours did not have a closet. But it did have a TV (not flat screen), kettle & coffees and fridge with milk. The A/C was fine. But if it stops working in the afternoon, call reception - they have an override switch and can turn it back on. Our room was tiny, so was our friends' - there are bigger rooms, but I guess you get what you pay for. Not that it was cheap over the New Year period. Security may be an issue. The lifts require your room key to access the floors, but if someone comes in the front door, they can walk up the stairs and are in the hotel. There is a number entry system from the street after 10pm. Twice we came back to find people trying to get in. One couple were indignant that I was not prepared to let them enter, until they showed me their room key. Even then, they didn't understand why I was doing what I was. The second occasion, the ne'er-do-well accepted my rejection, no doubt someone else let him in later. He did NOT belong there. Another time, my friend found a homeless person climbing the stairs to the 1st floor (2nd floor American) where reception is. He was asked to leave, but this must happen too often. Our friends were in 105, which is just at the top of the stairs as you enter. It is also above Charlie Chans' pub, which plays music loud and late. They were unable to sleep properly until 5am one Sunday night There is no room safe, but you can leave valuables at the front desk. However, they will ask if you are leaving cash, and then refuse to take the package if you say yes. So you have a choice of fibbing or not leaving cash. Another however - no receipt is given for the valuables, and to get them back, all you have to do is ask for your room number and you get that envelope back. No proof of you being in that room or anything. That needs to be rectified. Now the good things: It is near China Town, Darling Harbour, the free 555 bus to Circular Quay, and the Cheers pub, which shows the English Premier League matches. There is also a gym close by which you can use, as a guest of the hotel. There is a good breakfast place on George and Goulbourn Streets (NW corner) - La Francais - or something like that. The 3 Monkeys pub on George and Liverpool streets is a bit smarter than others near by. WiFi is AU$ 15 for a day's use - cheaper than many places, but not free. Boo. Minus points for that. Australia is particularly bad for not having free wifi. It is already an expensive place to visit, with the strength of their dollar, so AU$ 27.50 per day, which many place charge, is a bit steep. So Pensione at AU$15 isn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sandysu58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pensione Hotel for two nights with hubby and our adult son - we went to Sydney for Christmas shopping and also to attend a concert. The hotel itself is in an old building and the age shows a little in things like the small, fairly slow elevator, steep stairs etc. And, as I expected from earlier reviews, the room was quite small. However, the room and the hotel in general was clean and well maintained. The staff I dealt with were very friendly and helpful. On first entering the hotel I was concerned that the room might be noisy as it's close to some hotels etc, but there was no such problem. There is no onsite car parking, but you can get discounted parking rates at another hotel only a tiny distance away. There's also no fitness centre, but I understand that there's an arrangement with a nearby gym for use of their facilities - I didn't have time to try it out though. I wouldn't recommend the hotel - well, our room anyway - if you want to a room to work in, since there wasn't a table and the lighting was a little dim. However, for a place to base a shopping / entertainment trip to Sydney, it was perfect - close to public transport, shops, restaurants, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Luggage disappeared”
Reviews.Author: worldlee01
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the front desk and staff asked us to leave the bags in the same area shown in the photograph hear. We were shown a room that was available and when we returned our high priced camera equipment was stolen. 5 weeks of precious photography. We complained to the front desk and when we were leaving we were escorted out the door by the hotel mgr/owner, daring us not to say anything. Additionally the police were no help. They told us to go searching around Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jwheller
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive hotel room for one night and picked the Pensione Hotel. The staff was very friend and helpful. Walking up to my room I was skeptical since it faced the road but there were double windows that kept out 99% of the street nice, including the construction across the street. The room and bathroom were very clean and the bed comfortable. Being close to china town was a bonus and it's a quick walk up the road to some great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money and rubbish facilities”
Reviews.Author: Wilsonroom320
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an online agent, and the first issue is that I paid way over the odds. The first room they gave me didn't have a proper window. The second room they offered had a window but was much smaller. My main issue was with the bathroom - the sink is so small you can't get the kettle under the tap and there is absolutely nowhere to put soap, toothpaste etc. In the bedroom there is a small wardrobe but no drawer space and nowhere except the floor to put your suitcase. One lamp isn't working so the room is even darker. It's very difficult to work at my laptop because the chair is a lounging chair rather than a working chair. Would definitely not stay here again. The only good thing is that the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I wish we had found this place earlier”
Reviews.Author: notagain1948
Reviews.Content: After putting up with three nights at a terrible backpackers in Sydney, we decided to look for something better that wouldn't cost a fortune. That's when we found the Pensione Hotel. The Pensione describes itself as a boutique hotel, however, if you intend to stay, be aware that it doesn't have full hotel facilities. It is in fact an up-market backpackers so there are no coffee and tea facilities in the rooms but there was a fridge in our room and a decent sized flat screen tv. There is a clean, airy, decent sized guest lounge which has a kitchenette and fridge for guests to use. There is also internet access in the lounge for a cost of $5.00 an hour. The accommodation is very comfortable and clean, and the building is well maintained. We can't fault the service we received from the staff who were more than helpful. We booked our room via a "desperate for a bed for the night" online agency and paid $90 for our double room with ensuite. The regular tariff starts at $95.00 a night. The Pensione is well located in George Street, not far from Chinatown and Darling Harbour. There is a bus stop very close by from where you can catch the free green metro bus which does a circuit of George Street and Elizabeth Street from Central Railway station to Circular Quay and back. Very handy to know about if you are trying to economise. We also bought multi tickets that allowed us to travel unlimited distances on the buses, trains and ferries. We saved a lot of money that way too. If we go back to Sydney, we would certainly look at staying at the Pensione again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: WhenWeTravel
Reviews.Content: Found this place at the last minute, and thought for the price and for one night it was worth the punt. Newly renovated rooms - very European (small/ tidy). Daniel at the reception was a great young bloke, with a good attiude and service ethic. So close to the lively atmosphere of China Town (you can smell the aromas from the balconies) and lower George St - though an easy walk into city centre. We also stayed at a 4 star on the same trip, and had we known would have stayed here the whole time. A bonus was being able to use a nearby (fully equipped) gym.

Reviews.Title: “It's quirky, a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: DenzelBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Close to Central Station and next to Chinatown - lots of restaurants of all kinds nearby. Short corridors leading off to clusters of rooms gives it a quaint, old-fashioned feel. Rooms are clean and quiet, beds are comfortable, the bathroom lacks an exhaust fan, but otherwise great. Good guest lounge where you can prepare your own meals, and very good breakfast pack for $10 at reception. Parking stations are nearby and the hotel gets a discount - $30 for overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient location - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: dotcomdotau
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights here on my 3rd trip to Sydney so was aware that this was in a very convenient location - walking distance from Central Station, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, and just around the corner from the Capital Theatre. Bus stop is almost outside front door that will take you for $2 to Circular Quay (also a free shuttle bus available) Small rooms but recently refurbished. Has a community lounge and kitchen that I didn't use. Halls a bit drab and dark, lift a bit slow. Some construction across the road and as usual in Sydney sirens are likely to wake you a few times each night. As a solo female traveller in her 50's I find that there are so many people in the streets at all hours that I do not feel uncomfortable. Great place if you are on a tight budget - if not then go for something a bit fancier.

Reviews.Title: “Bed was terrible so ended up sleeping on...”
Reviews.Author: Mlnjaq
Reviews.Content: Bed was terrible so ended up sleeping on one of the very hard bunk beds. There is no excuse for a saggy baggy springy bed... A hotels business is beds! Would not stay again because of the poor sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: universal17
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, staff, rooms etc... I really felt comfortable, and it's right in the heart of Sydney city. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SasDex83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pensione Sydney for a weekend back in April and found the hotel to be a really great place to stay. I originally booked as they had a great special going through Expedia and I thought I would give it a go. I couldn't fault it - you get what you pay for and I was impressed with all aspects of the hotel. The locations is excellent - really close to everything which is handy when you don't know Sydney that well. The staff were excellent and had great local knowledge. Rooms are on the small side, but hey, you can't have everything. They were clean, comfortable and even though I was on the street side I didn't hear any noise. I'll definitely be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Whats behind the brown door?”
Reviews.Author: arizonagcs
Reviews.Content: When the taxi driver had difficulty finding the hotel and he drew up in front wooden double doors on the edge of China Town I wondered what I had let myself in for! I dragged my bags up the front steps and into the lift up to the reception and was actually met by a pleasant, helpful staff member who after upgrading the room gave me useful information of how to get around Sydney. It was a bit of a pain to get the luggage into the lift again, up some stairs but once in the room I was surprised how quite it was, clean, had a flat screen tv and a decent bathroom. Like any budget hotel right in the heart of the city don't expect a view, I wasn't intending to stay in my room so that didn't matter. The TV has BBC World News, which although a small consideration, meant I could keep up with an important breaking news story at home. Armed with the staff's information I was able to walk up the street to catch the train to Circular Quay just 2 stops away. The buses also stop on George street. The hotel is in a similar area to a few backpackers hostels but is far superior in its standards. The door is shut at 10pm but a code is given for easy access. Breakfast is not included but there plenty of places to eat including a lovely French style patisserie across the road. Being in China Town, I thought I was still in Hong Kong, there are a variety of ethnic places to eat. For the center of a city it is quiet and easily excessable and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “I guess we had bad luck”
Reviews.Author: mfebles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and IÂ´ll try to leave a fair review. We arrived really early (around 9am) and we could check in (check time was supposed to be at 2pm) so we could have a nap in our room after a long trip. Our problem is that the first night we had a room that was just above a pub... it was a friday night with the World Cup on (from 1am til 7 am in Australia) so were hearing the broadcasting and music the whole night. The next morning we told the guy on the front desk about this problem and he gave us a new room a free internet for 1 day (12$), the problem now was that the new room had old windows and let the cold from outside come into the room and also noise from some building construction that started at 7am.
