The hotel was clean and had a convenient location, just minutes from Chinatown. Also there is a free shuttle bus stop just meters from the main door, so you can go to the Opera Area for free. Overall the hotel was good but I guess we had bad luck, maybe if we had stay in weekday our experience would have been different.

Reviews.Title: “'Central To Everything'”
Reviews.Author: Nattnz
Reviews.Content: Except for a fire alarm at 5am (false alarm thank goodness), this hotel is central to absolutely everything, like all public transport, a super quick trip to the international airport (by train) awesome place at a budget price. Recommend to everyone and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: woowoo75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the start of June, based on price and reviews on Trip Advisor. I arrived early at 12pm and got an upgrade room and was able to check in. Great start!. The room was a single, and perfect size, comfy bed and really couldn't find fault. I had also requested a quiet room and the one I had was great, 3rd floor and away from the buzz if George St. For the price, its a bargin, great location if you are spending time in the CBD, but easy to get to everything. Apart from 2 fire alarms, both thankfully false alarms, I think this is fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “going above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Tolstoy13
Reviews.Content: This review is waaaaay late in coming, since it was last November when I stayed there. However I just moved and came across my vacation photos and felt that guilty pang about not getting the good word out sooner. So here goes: I stayed there for a week in Nov 2009, thought the location was great and loved that the hotel was so modern and clean. Booked a double premium and realized that the windows didn't open, only air-conditioning for air circulation. I had checked in and left immediately to meet a friend for "High Tea" at the QVB, but mentioned in passing to Ross at reception that I would much prefer to have a room with opening windows, so my allergies won't act up. He was right on it and offered to move me into a different room right there. All said and done, I was in a different room and on the way to meet my friend within 20 minutes. Stayed there for the remainder of the week and had a great experience, checked out Saturday and got on a plane to Melbourne. Here's the kicker: On the plane I realized that I had left a credit card and my green card in the hotel safe in the first room. OMG! Called Ross as soon as I landed. He was incredibly sweet, told me that there wasn't much hope since the room had been occupied since, but that he would go up and look right now. Miracle - my stuff was still there!!! Ross then proceeded to make arrangements to have DHL ship it all to me to my hotel in Melbourne and called and kept me posted of his progress all the way. Then there was a mix-up with delivery (DHL's fault) and Ross was on the phone with them immediately to make sure I got everything back and was able to come home to the US without a problem. Thank you, Ross - you are gem!!! All in all, I will stay there again the next time I'm in Sydney and I hope Ross will one day get to run his own hotel, since he TRULY understands the meaning of the word "customer service".

Reviews.Title: “3-Minutes from Everything!”
Reviews.Author: leonbec
Reviews.Content: Booked a Premium Triple during my recent trip - 3 Adults + a 2yr old toddler. The rooms were superb but it's sad that the amenities are not refreshed on a daily basis. We stayed 3 days 2 nights and on the 1st night, we bought dinner back and made coffee in the room. The next day we were out on our tour and they were not refreshed. Neither were the bath shower gels. We got the rooms on Sussex Street, the only inconvenience were the connection back into George Street was through a small alley and there were stairs in the way which we had to ludge them up / down. Check out times are 10:00am but the Guest Lounge on the 1st floor is extremely convenient - it has all anyoene would need at a reasonable price. Lockers are at AUD5 for a minimum of 3hours, internet kiosks & drink kiosks and free microwave & fridge rentals. There's also a washer & dryer for AUD3 per wash. Coles & Woolworths are down George Street so it's a short distance to walk to get your emergency groceries. Chinatown & Paddy's Market is a corner away and food is so convenient. Baby Thai a restaurant that serves superb Thai cuisine at food court pricing is located right downstairs when you take the lift down Sussex Street, else it's 2 doors away to a nice Vietnamese Restaurant on George Street or the array of chinese restaurants in Chinatown. Charlie Chan's - a local run bar is downstairs if you need a fix of beer. We stayed on the 3rd floor and have no issue putting my girl to sleep - no disturbance from the bar downstairs at all. The Free CBD Shuttle which runs till 3:30pm daily stops right outside the hotel - which takes you to Darling Harbour (Town Hall) and up to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Whero
Reviews.Content: My 5 year old son and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April 2010. We had booked the smallest room-the petite double-but on arrival we were upgraded to a larger double room at the back of the hotel for no extra charge. The hotel is a rambly renovated older style building. There was plenty of natural light in our room, it was tastefully decorated without feeling 'hotel like' & impersonal, and clean & fresh. There was a lounge on the first level with a kitchen, internet kiosks and laundry. The room was double glazed but my only gripe was that there was a large light well outside our room that opened out onto the ground level to a bar & arcade. At night the noise from the bar echoed up to our room and as the week went on became louder and louder. ... The hotel was however well located-just by China Town & the Markets-and Central Station was about a 10 minute walk away with the World Square just across the road with a Coles Supermarket. We liked the French Bakery just up the road from the hotel, and there is a small Spanish Quarter one block away so there were plenty of food options. The staff were helpful and friendly to us both and I thought the hotel was good value for money. My 5 year old liked it too as there were plenty of staircases to explore. Yes we would stay there again if we are ever in Sydney and we would probably give the Pensione Hotel in Melbourne a try too.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: cometocapetown
Reviews.Content: Did not expect much after reading reviews, but I have to say that my stay was fantastic! For the small price I payed I got a modern, clean room with a awesome en-suite bathroom. I stayed in a standard double room. Although the room were small, it had all the basic amenities, fridge, kettle, etc. Would recommend this hotel for someone looking for GREAT value for money. Right in the middle of China Town, 20 minutes walking from the Sydney Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “value and location”
Reviews.Author: chooMelbourne
Reviews.Content: excellent value for top city location...close to everything and nicely funished rooms. bathrooms are excellent..quaint building with a cool heritage elevator in the front...its not the taj mahal but good for the price

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: sophiekf
Reviews.Content: After knowing what good value it's sister hotel the Pensione Melbourne is, I was looking forward to staying here in Sydney. However, when we arrived we were immediately disappointed. The reception and entrance area was quite depressing and the lift was broken, when meant lugging our luggage up flights of stairs. The receptionist was unwelcoming and cold. After being accidentally given the wrong room, we then went to our correct room, which was dingy and a bit uncomfortable. The TV was on the wall in an odd position, which made it hard to watch. The bathrooms however were more modern and felt clean, which was good. The location is also fairly convenient as it's near Central Station and plenty of public transport. You can also walk to many places from here. However it is quite noisy at nighttime - there are definitely nicer areas to stay in. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel, especially for what we paid. This place definitely needs a big renovation and friendlier service.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in good location for restaurants”
Reviews.Author: HumbleGourmet
Reviews.Content: If you choose this hotel knowing that budget prices mean smaller cosy rooms and basic fittings, then you are onto a winner. The basics were all there such as a comfortable bed with good sheets and an adequate bathroom. The excellent aspects are the price and where its located on the edge of Chinatown with restaurants everywhere. Darling Harbour is nearby too and you are have great access to public transport - eg: buses at the front door, World Square station for monorail. Restaurant Tip: Round the corner in Goulburn St is "Mamak" for authentic super fast Malaysian food and rated as one of the best "cheap eats" in Sydney - a real gourmet experience - 3 big courses and drinks for $25 each! Their ayam goreng is fried chicken a bit like KFC (!) but transformed into something truly wonderful! We had to queue for 10mins but thats because everyone knows this is THE place to be! Try the desserts even though they sound strange (red beans and flavoured ice topped by creamed corn?!?).

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel in a fantastic location contained in an amazing building.”
Reviews.Author: CurtisMan
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfectly clean. The front desk staff were very friendly and willing to answer any questions. They ensured I was comfortable for my stay and offered any assistance required. The cleaning staff were always smiling and greeting me. The building is amazing. Not only in a great location but the building itself is historical which means the hallways were on different levels and there are twists and turns everywhere - this gives the hotel some really great character. Although it is historical, the hotel was re-modeled so everything is new and fresh and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, suitable for Budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: AmatureTravelFreak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pensione Sydney in December 2009. Since we stayed at Pensione Melbourne before goiong to Sydeny, we kinda know what to expect of the hotel. You can't expect much space in a city hotel especially if it is conveniently located like this one. The room was small but enough to get by. In fact, the bathroom was bigger compared to what we got used to in Melbourne. Overall, the experience was good especially with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellers021
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and on entering Reception we felt quite depressed. The hotel needed a good lick of paint and updating. It got worse when we reached our room which was supposed to be a deluxe petit double. Petit it certainly was with no room either side of bed for even a small chest of drawers, therefore having to get out of bed to switch off the alarm! There was no wardrobe and about 5 hooks on the wall for hanging your clothes. These were fixed with just one screw so bewareas they will collapse with even a light coat. As for being DELUXE it was really basic looking with just a chest of drawers, bed and TV on wall, with the addition of a useful fridge. Shower room was good size and excellent power shower. On the plus side room was very clean and comfortable bed. One redeeming thing is the location and also the Guest Lobby/Lounge which provides luggage lockers, kettle, fridge, microwave and internet. This was extremely useful after checking out at 10.00 and waiting to leave some time in the afternoon. We were only there for 2 nights otherwise we might have challenged the DELUXE room as we wondered if we had been put in the wrong room!! We previously stayed at The Mecure just a few blocks away. Next time we will go back there.

Reviews.Title: “too small and too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: djallen0
Reviews.Content: no where to put anything in bathroom, room extremely small, room near reception very noisy at night, staff not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service, rooms and location!”
Reviews.Author: jackkkkk
Reviews.Content: I headed into the city for a friends birthday and wanted somewhere close and well priced. We were all very pleased with the Pensione. Right out the front of the hotel is a busstop allowing us to catch the FREE CBD shuttle bus up to the harbour. The hotel was right around the corner from some amazing chinese restaurants, and everything we needed was within walking distance. We had a few premium rooms, and they were amazing. Very clean and beds were very comfy. I cant understand how some people can think this is a backpackers hostel? Its definately a boutique hotel. As far as noise, its SYDNEY! what could you expect on a friday night? The staff at the front desk were always friendly, and were more than happy to arrange taxis and give suggestions for things to do. All in all, it was an amazing experience, and we will DEFINATELY be staying here on the next birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small”
Reviews.Author: petals526
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, has the free Green city bus stopping outside the hotel. Room was small but who cares when you can walk barefoot on the carpet and lay on the fluffy white bed without being grossed out, we were on the 3rd Floor and I believe that they have been renovated. Great hotel price on the internet, so so worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Great service EXCELLENT location!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzery
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pensione many times and I am pretty shocked at all these reviews. The hotel is in a perfect location right in the center of Sydney. And you'd have to be kidding yourself if you didn't expect a little noise when staying in the countries busiest cities. Although I had no problems from the bar below I have had friends travel with me and there has been some noise. But after bringing it up the the desk staff they were moved to a much quieter room. It is not a backpacker hostel. I have stayed in many all around the world and in no way what so ever does it resemble a hostel. Its exactly what they call it the cheapest boutique hotel in Sydney. Some of the rooms can be on the smaller side but it has never bothered me as I am only ever in the room to get some sleep after big day sightseeing. The staff are wonderful, all know the area very well and always more than happy to answer the hundreds of questions I throw at them. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Backpacker Hostel NOT Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supercalafragalistic
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the pokiness of the room that astonished me - i was expecting it to be small given I booked a single room. My issues were with pretty much EVERYTHING else. I paid $166 for the one night expecting a small quaint Boutique hotel. What i got was a backpacker style accommodation. I have no problem with backpacker accommodation when that is what i pay for but at those rates a higher quality must be expected. The reception was nothing special/ on the verge of rude, there was no space to unpack so all my clothes ended up being spread on the dirty carpet and my toiletries on the floor of the bathroom. However, the worst part was that i didn't sleep a wink all night. The curtain in the room was too short and so the city lights shine in at night then at day break the sun streams in RIGHT into your eyes as the bed is situated underneath this curtain. The bed was also uncomfortably small (width and length - and i'm not a big/ tall person by any measure). There was no complaint for in the room or at reception so it's not like they are interested in receiving feedback on the crap-ness of the "hotel". I've stayed in some dodgy accommodation before but this one was truly bad. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Da-bosman
Reviews.Content: Great location and very helpfull staff. Little noisy but that can be expected when you are right on the main road (george street). Easy access to anywhere in Sydney from here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Emmyjanine
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I recently stayed at this hotel, and i must say the location was great!! So close to everything and very central. Although the room was quite small, (we had a deluxe double, so i would hate to think how small the petite room was) however it was very clean & tidy and the decor was modern & funky! My only negative aspects would be that it is a little noisy of an evening and cigarette smoke seemed to drift into the bathroom, both coming (i assume) from the downstairs bar. We took advantage of an accommodation voucher so the rate was very well priced and great value for money! I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Grahamanz
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel based purely on location from a map and the description. And the price seemed reasonable. Then as I researched further I came across the reviews of the hotel and also photos. Some reviews were so bad we approached our stay with some trepidation. Sure the outside appearance and entry were a little offputting and our first experience of the lift was a little scary. However when we learnt how to operate it with our security card there was no problem. The room although small was spotless and the ensuite roomy and clean. There was a small frig and wardrobe and large security safe and also tea/coffee making facilities. The room was serviced daily. I had read about the noise but to be honest we never found that. We were one room back from the busy George St and the most noise we experienced was that of doors closing, partly because of the strong automatic closures. There was a roomy guest lounge with internet facilities(which I never used) and also a variety of lockers. Others had criticised the cost but it was not a problem to us and we found it very convenient to store our belongings between checkout and final departure. By far the greatest attraction to us was the location. We depended entirely on public transport and with a bus stop right outside the door and maximum waiting time for a bus about a minute was fantastic. There is a free CBD bus approx every ten minutes. We bought a seniors pass every day for 2.50 and that gave us unlimited transport all day on buses, trains and ferries. Would we go back, yes I think we would however the peak room rates would be too much and we would have to pick the season. Altogether we found the many negative reviews unreasonable and came awy feeling pretty happy

Reviews.Title: “Beware - no sleep ahead!!!”
Reviews.Author: xumbah
Reviews.Content: IF you want a quiet, relaxing and intimate time with your partner DO NOT chose this hotel. Located above a dingy bar with irritating customers and plums of cigarette smoke (which seeps into your room), the pensione should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the rooms at the back...you will get no sleep at all”
Reviews.Author: Thaiowl
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night for a stopover in Sydney on the way back to Bangkok. The choice was to stay near the aiport or stay in town. We chose the latter and regretted it. We had two rooms costing AUD350. For less than that we had previously stayed in a 2-bedoomed appt at the Medina Executive in George Street, which was very good and I would recommend it. The rooms at the Pensione are indeed small, but everything worked so we couldn't complain. However, our room (218) was at the back of the building and overlooked the very noisy (and evidently smoky) bar which kept us up until 4:30am. The room is meant to be non-smoking but it stinks of smoke as the smoke from the bar finds its way into the room. There is double glazing in the bedroom but it is pretty useless at keeping out the noise. My kids stayed in another (internal) room and had a good night's sleep. I'm glad we didn't have to endure another night in room 218 or we would have been ill from sleep deprivation. Avoid this room at all costs. If you have a family, go to the Medina Executive.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: cupcaketraveller
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Sydney for leisure and had a wonderful stay at Pensione. Staff were helpful, location is fantastic and hotel is clean and comfortable at a budget traveller price. I would recommend going for their deluxe option and asking for an internal room if possible as it's a noisy part of town. As long as you're realistic in your expectations - you're staying in a busy and noisy part of Sydney at a hotel that clearly markets itself to budget travellers - you'll have a great time at Pensione.

Reviews.Title: “Location to suit”
Reviews.Author: fwharry
Reviews.Content: Went to Sydney to see the sights, catch up with friends and family and of course shopping. Booked Pensione prior to arriving and emailed concierge re early arrivals and late departures. Was told all information I needed to know about our stay. Found the room clean and tidy, not noisy at all considering the construction going on across the road. Overall our stay was great. Location was fantastic as we explored all the eateries nearby - what hidden treasures there are near the hotel - as well as being really central to all our needs. Perfect for a couple or like myself (mum & daughter) who like to explore. Shared amentites were always clean and when asked the reception staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: KT785
Reviews.Content: I stayed 25-26 March in a single room. The location was great, on George street, beside Chinatown. The single room was REALLY small and was just the same size as the attached bathroom. When I lay down in the bed, the curtain was literally over my head over my head,(see photo) so much so that I moved the bed nearer the door. The real peeve beyond that? You have to leave your luggage in lockers which cost A$3-7 (I always manage to check out, leave the bags with reception/concierge before continuing sightseeing and I leave the location - couldn't so this here), and you don't even get a kettle/coffee/tea making utenils in your room. Trying to ask anything at the reception is a bummer as there always seems to be a bunch of people waiting ahead of you - I tried 5 times and gave up 3 of these. I looked at the double rooms, but even these were just so-so, and quite small. Not quite what I expect of a boutique hotel. They say there is a fitness centre available "near" the hotel (Fitness First downtown), but is 1 km away on foot either way - great to jog to in good weather, but a bummer in rain!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rather deceptive advertising”
Reviews.Author: splatcat78
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our stay here didn't get off to a good start, to begin with we had to wait for a taxi at the airport of over an hour and a half and didn't arrive at the hotel until nearly midnight. We were greeted by the clerk who proceeded to gives us our keys and inform us that we'd been 'upgraded from our deluxe double room to a deluxe triple room' - not really the upgrade I'd been hoping for considering there were only two of us - not five. The room was extremely disapointing in that this 'funky boutique hotel', as quoted by Hotelclub was not a hotel at all but merely a glorified backpackers hostel. Our room was located right next to the outdoor area i.e. smokers area, and communal facilities. The actual bed and bathroom was clean enough but the carpet fo the room was filthy and adjacent to our double bed we had a triple bunk! When we queried this false advertising of it being a 'hotel' with the girl at reception the next morning and requested that we be at least moved to a room that wouldn't experience so many disruptions, we were told that they were fully booked and coudln't accomodate our request, not very helpful at all. I would recommend this place for the location and for a 'basic, budget style accommodation', but not for a boutique hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in excellent location- great value for money”
Reviews.Author: emld1984
Reviews.Content: Stumbled on this hotel after trying to find an affordable place to stay in Sydney for a few nights. We were able to get a room for $99/ night (free upgrade to superior room when we arrived). Found the booking system to be very hassle free, I've had some bad experiences with hotel reservations in the past so it was a nice change to not have to pay a deposit over the internet etc. The rooms are small, but clean- functional and practical but maybe not for you if you need lots of room or luxurious surrounds. I found the staff to be polite, but not too chatty. By far the best thing about this hotel is the location- very easy access to all the excellent attractions Sydney has to offer (easy walk to Chinatown/ Darling Harbour/ City- free bus right outside if you don't want to walk. Also- the hotel is only a 2 minute walk away from the best food court I've ever seen ($5.80 for dinner!). All in all my stay was hassle- free, perfect for me as I've been to Sydney many times before and was just looking for somewhere I could stay on a budget. Maybe the hotel wouldn't be suitable if you're looking for something more upmarket, but if you want somewhere clean, convenient and safe I would definitely recommend this hotel. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a nice area of the city”
Reviews.Author: panzr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my 11 year old son in March '09 The room was small but everything was clean and tidy. It's very handy to China Town and the fantastic Market is around the corner, with Darling harbour not too far but Circular Quay is far to walk although buses are aplenty Being on the main street, traffic is a bit noisy although I expected this and had ear plugs prepared. During our stay there was a major highrise being built directly across the street which woke us early in the morning, no big deal though Despite being out seeing the sights most of the time and only using the hotel as a place to sleep, our stay was pleasant, especially as we were in such a fantastic city...Sydney really is a wonderful place to visit Staff were pleasant and the room attendants were very polite Although, I must say the TV in the room was uncomfortable to watch as it was perched directly above the beds, oh and the windows really need a clean on the outside

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in Sydney if not Australia”
Reviews.Author: B184
Reviews.Content: I had no expectations for my stay at the Pension. I only wanted a clean room and somewhere to sleep but from the minute I walked in the door I knew I had made a mistake booking my accommodation there. When you walk in the front door there is a dirty old lift or a dirty stircase. At reception we were greeted with "What do you want?" throughout the check in process the lady on duty did not smile, make eye contact or even attempt to make small talk. I asked if we could pay on check out which she said was fine but she needed to sight my credit card and then proceeded to swip my credit card and do a preauthorisation without any explaination (so basically she held funds on my credit card for 5 working day which is something that should be explained) We then to the room where we found a king spit bed and bunk beds. The bunk beds we had to make ourselves with the dirty blankets that were left on the bed and we were disappointed becuase I had requested 4 single beds and was told there would be no way to do that when infact they only had to pull apart the king bed to make 2 singles I mean thats what a king split is design for. After an evening out we came back to the room about 3am wanting to go to sleep, unfortuently none of us got any sleep that night. There is a bar downstairs that plays loud music and you can hear the people talking like they are sitting outside your door. After 3 calls to the night manager nothing was done about the noise. The music didnt stop until 5.30am and by that time we were all so annoyed that we couldnt sleep. The only nice thing about our stay was that the gentleman on reception the next was very polite and he did give us a reduction on our room rate but my friends and I would have much prefered a good night sleep

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Central and Simple”
Reviews.Author: stray1001
Reviews.Content: The Pensione is what it claims to be -- clean, simple rooms in a historic building in the centre of town. I found it less than noisy than I expected (even though my room overlooked George Street). It was fully booked when I was there so I did not have much choice of room, but I slept well nonetheless. If space or luxury is a priority, then this is probably not the right hotel. Otherwise it was definitely good value and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: otagotraveller
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice, and would have stayed a third time had it not been booked out on that occasion. It's a great location, a character building that's been nicely refurbished. Everything was clean and in order, and most of the staff friendly. I think the trick is to see if you can get a room facing into the light-well in the middle of the building, rather than onto the street. The interior rooms are quiet. I probably wouldn't want one on George St though. We really liked the shared lounge area, with a kitchen and internet - seemed a useful thing to have if you had a smallish room. We spent a bit of time hanging out in the communal space. The Pensione is on a main bus route, and really close to Central Station, which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agalwaygirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was for 8 nights in the deluxe room. To be honest I felt the photos and description of this hotel led me to believe that this place was nicer than it actually was. It was cheap and cheerful. Room was okay, very clean and spacious, although it did have an interior window that seemed to look out onto an empty hall space which I found very disconcerting and did not like as there was no natural light at all. When we enquired at reception about possibly changing rooms, unfortunately there were none available. Location was good, quiet central. Staff were pleasant but not friendly. To be honest, we found ourselves finding excuses not to go back to the hotel early as the room was quite depressing. We also came back one night to find a drunk fast asleep in the front hall downstairs, that we had to step over him to access the hotel, not a nice experience. We will not be staying here again, I felt it was barely above a hostel. I felt it was advertised wrongly as a boutique hotel, leading me to believe it was better than reality.

Reviews.Title: “quaint and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: prajnaparamita
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint and pleasant hotel. Ten minutes walk to the Central Railway station where you can catch the train to the airport. Just around the corner is China Town & it is easy walking distance from Darling Harbour and the Queen Victoria Building. I had a quiet room at the back. The room was clean with modern decor. The bathroom was great. The airconditioner worked well and was quiet. The only drawback was that my room looked into other rooms opposite, which meant there was no privacy unless you shut the curtains, but it didn't really bother me. A good hotel (though it would pay to ask for a quiet room as those at the front overlook busy and noisy George Street.)

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Midget_Gems
Reviews.Content: This was a clean and compact hotel centrally located on George Street. My single room can only be described as a broom cupboard..it was small, hard no wardrobe or anywhere to put my clothes so asked for a portable wardrobe that was provided but only just fit in the room. The redeeming feature of the room was the bathroom which was almost as big as the room but was obviously recently re-fitted. My main issue with this hotel was really who it is marketed to. From the website it gives the impression that this is a more slightly more sophisicated boutique hotel but really it is only one step up from a youth hostel and consequently as we found out has the same clientele. It was very loud not only from the other guests staying there but also due to the construction site right next door that started using an angle grinder as 6am. We complained straight away but were told it was not their problem and that if we were to move from the hotel we would have to pay a nights accomodation to cancel. They did however find rooms for all of my party on the opposite side of the hotel to the building site. For myself, it is not somewhere the I will rush to stay at again but if you are looking for somewhere cheap to stay thats clean and you don't mind the the noise then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean”
Reviews.Author: kapibarasan
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel, I chose it mainly for its location, in Chinatown, very good to explore the city, either walking or by public transportation. I was not disappointed by the location, and I also found that it was very clean indeed, as I had previously read on other reviews here. Good location and clean room are the 2 most important things to me, and this hotel did not disappoint me. The room was very small as I had also read on another guidebook, but I planned on staying almost the whole day out of the room, exploring the city, so I didn't care about that. It can be very noisy at any time of the day or the night, both because of the cleaning people and (mainly) because of people who have no respect of the others. Wireless internet was expensive, however the area is full of internet cafe's. Overall a good experience to me, would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and very clean, but LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: jen99va80
Reviews.Content: The Pensione is at great location on George Street. Buses right outside go to Circle Quay every few minutes and its a short walk to Darling Harbour. The rooms are clean and there is GREAT shower pressure. A good option for a group of 3-- we booked a triple and had a bunk bed and a double... it was really nice not to have to share. The elevator ("lift") was in working condition and the steps from the top (4th) floor were a great option in a hurry with no luggage. The only downside was loud George Street especially on Saturday night-- bring some earplugs and/ or ask for an inside room.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KerryDurango
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel i ever stayed in. "Boutique hotel" how are you? It was my worst nightmare of a hotel. From the entrance i knew i had been caught out by web site. Nothing on ground floor only grotty entrance grotty lift and grotty staircase! Reception on 2nd floor. Wow!! Before checking in i even asked could i see the room. Girl showed it to me. Was not impressed with it but after 9 hour flight needed a lie down. Certainly not up to standards! We even washed bathroom floor ourselves! It was filty! Booked trip room - got double bed and bunks - didnt know hotels had bunks. No tea or coffee making facilities. Common kitchen area on 1st floor. Tea towels filthy. No way could one use it. Internet use $2 for 20 min (next door $2 for 1 HOUR. Laurdrette - $3 wash $3 washing powder and $3 dry. Costly! Met up with friends outside hotel and was ashamed to say that i was even staying there. They are local in sydney and could not believe it. I would not even recommend it to bagpackers! Stay well clear if you have any sense!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, home like”
Reviews.Author: Milonotovaltine
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews posted here, I guess I was allocated a quiet spot. The room was odor free and quiet. I rested peacefully. What I like best about this hotel is that their bed linens and towels smell fresh, the shampoo is very good, and clean room. What is slightly disappointing is that amenities were not replaced/replenished. Internet access is only available in the guest lounge, which closes at 10 pm, cold, smells of food. The internet speed is quite slow when there are several people using it. Overall, I am satisfied with my stay and will not hesitate to book again. Although I believe the rate is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharonCapeTown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is misrepresented as a boutique hotel. It is definitly a hostel. Within 2 hours of checking in I check out, after managing to find a room at the Ibis at Darling Harbour. As I have pre-paid through Hotelclub.net, I quite readily forfeited this as 3 nights would have been unbearable! Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Like trying to go to sleep in the bar of my local pub...”
Reviews.Author: fishie82
Reviews.Content: The "Delux" room was tiny, the bathroom was just clean enough. There was a distinct smell of cigarettes in the room (non-smoking hotel). When going to bed, the bed had only one thin blanket on it and the heater did not work. After several attempts to get through to reception to request more bankets, was told I could come down and get them or wait half an hour for her to bring them up. Then spent the next few hours lying in bed, listening to the coversations and crashes and noises from pokies coming from the bar downstairs. The cigarette smell got worse as people who smoked had to go to a little spot underneath our window to do so! The bar closed at 3:00 am. A very sleepless night and when we checked out, the new receptionist was not at all interested in our comments on the room. Not happy Jan! Will not go back for seconds.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and safe with good rate”
Reviews.Author: socaltransplant
Reviews.Content: The room i shared with a friend had a bunk bed and a full size bed. It was more like an upscale hostel than a real hotel, but it was perfect for what we needed - a somewhat central location to stop in and shower, change and sleep between visiting all that Sydney has to offer. The staff was friendly, rooms clean, and fellow travelers fairly respectful when it came to noise. its a younger clientele, but that's to be expected for the price. I would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Under-whelming”
Reviews.Author: dallhiss
Reviews.Content: I found a disparity between the hotel's exaggerated marketing descriptions ('grandeur,' 'style,' and 'unique') and the actual experience. Yes, the hotel is conveniently located in the CBD/Chinatown area; however, it is also located on a busy, noisy eyesore of a block. My 'deluxe' double was plain, cramped and noisy (from both the street and the stairwell); and with an extended weekend rate of AUD143, not a particularly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lome1984
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly large hotel on George Street, on the edge of China town. It has 3 floors and is over Charlie Chan's bar & restaurant. It has a 24 hour reception and I found the staff helpful. It's a good location with easy bus access to the Harbour and Bondi and it's close to the monorail and Central Railway Station. Only thing I didn't like was when one of the kids got chocolate on the sheets and they weren't changed.

Reviews.Title: “"Misleading Description "- I agree”
Reviews.Author: Megan08
Reviews.Content: I agree wholeheartedly with the review "Misleading Description" Jan 16, 08. I am only sorry I didn't read it before I booked. I asked for a quiet room - what a joke - it was on George Street, the windows were not double glazed, and the street noise was so loud I had to have the volume on the TV almost at the maximum to be able to hear it. I could not sleep, even with earplugs. Below is an irish pub surrounded by 'adult shops'. The building's interior was extremely shabby, with chipped paint, no bedside table or lamp, old worn carpet. I had to pay to have my luggage kept while waiting for my room to be ready. I imagine that Backpacker hostels have better facilities - I would never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive backpackers not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate070
Reviews.Content: This is not a boutique hotel, but a good backpackers. The 'deluxe' room for a $185 is laughable, the only reason we didn't walk out is that there was literally no other accommodation available. The problems were (i) rooms smelt, (ii) windows fithly, (iii) cigarette burns in bedspread, (iv) fan in bathroom didn't work, (v) apart from soap no tolietries provided (vi) the room's layout extremely awkward with cheap ottomans, furniture and TV set and worst of all the noise from George St. horrific, especially with the window open if you want fresh air. Although, the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely hated this place...”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: This is a really grotty place to stay; we decided on it because its website positions the hotel as a "boutique" hotel, which we understand to mean small, intimate, with a degree of luxury. Instead, its basically a former hostel that has been turned into a hotel. The first indication of this is that you have to PAY for lockers to store your bags if you arrive before check in; I have never heard of such a thing in all the many places I have travelled before. and those lockers are not cheap either! We paid $185 for a room which we thought was a good price point for a boutique; in return for that we got a tiny box of a room that was completely barren of comfort. dingy paint work, a rattly old window that allowed all of the noise of george street to penetrate. there is no bedside lamp so you have to turn the light off at the door and then stumble in the dark to your bed (bring a torch!). the bathroom was also tiny, with scratchy towels and no toiletries other than a piece of soap. there was one glass shelf next to the tiny sink, but it was on an angle so anything you put on it rolled off and fell on the tiled floor. seriously ick!! bad lighting, a TV that did not work, and no desk finished the furnishings. the lifts are extremely slow so that usually the stairs are the best option. we immediately tried to find another place to stay but Sydney seemed to be completely booked out for this saturday night so we were stuck. i used earplugs to keep the noise out, but woke up at 5.30am with a headache from the roar. we ended up checking out at 7am and heading home to Melbourne early because a nice-lie in was clearly not on the cards. I can not believe that it is possible to charge $185 a night for such appalling accommodation!!! I would not recommend this to anyone; if you are on a budget then go stay at the YHA where you can get your own room for a 1/3 of that price; if you are actually looking for a decent hotel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: kaldal
Reviews.Content: Payed through the nose to stay here over New Year's. The hotel is very well located, the rooms are nice and comfy, but extremely small, even the deluxe we had (only difference is a few amenities). Staff was ordinary (helpful enough), and we were bothered with a loud alarm going off three times ("the stupid elevator", according to one receptionist).

Reviews.Title: “Misleading description”
Reviews.Author: EL_SG
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel is an overly generous term for this place. A more apt description would be glorified backpackers hostel. My family booked 2 doubles after being informed that the quad room was not available. On our arrival, we were told we were upgraded to a deluxe room FOC for one of our rooms which we found was large enough to sleep 4! The price difference was rather significant and we were understandably upset cos we were told it was not available on booking. The receptionist at night, who was of asian origin, was very very unhelpful and rude about it. She raised her voice and said there was nothing that can be done about it and rudely instructed us to speak to the manager who will only be in the next morning. All the while, she just sounded very frustrated and kept raising her voice. It was as if she was the customer who was let down in the first place!! She just kept repeating the same answer and refuse to help us clarify our doubts, instead, just pushed everything to the morning. Breakfast offered is a joke. It's charged at AUD$8 or so and consists of a box of dry rations with cornflakes, muesli, a packet of milk etc. A poor backpacker who booked the breakfast option was stunned when handed 3 packs for his 3 day stay and when asked if he was meant to eat in the room, the receptionist just replied (loudly), "we do not have a cafeteria" belligerently. That said, the receptionist in the morning, a young asian girl, was utterly sweet, helpful and nice. She was far more professional and although had many people to handle, was unfailingly polite and helpful. Rooms wise, there was no closet for the standard room. Neither is there a fridge, tea/coffee making facilities. There was no window as well. Carpets were threadbare and room was plain with no decorations. Room was also so small that there was literally no space to put my luggage. The 'upgraded' room had pipes (the relatively big ones) running through them in the room. The only thing that can be classified as a boutique hotel is the bathroom which was nicely decorated with good water pressure. I have honestly stayed in far better hostels in Sydney before and have a word for people who are attracted to the less than accurate photos on their website. Book at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: atta79
Reviews.Content: Nice interior, clean rooms, friendly staff, perfect location (very close to Darling Harbour). Best city-hotel in this price category I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad of the Pensione”
Reviews.Author: Forwardplanner
Reviews.Content: My partner and my friends recently stayed in 2 Deluxe rooms at the Pensione. On reading the reviews I was a bit nervous and brought this to the attention of the reception staff on arrival. He attempted to move us both but unfortunately could only move one room so I am fairly qualified to compare the two. Firstly, the reviews are right. The rooms along George Street are noisy 24/7 so make sure you ask in advance for one that is not along that side of the building! In saying that, my friends were moved the next day as soon as another room became available. The staff member was excellent. I travel to Sydney very often for work and stay in 5 star hotels. The cost per night of these range between $300 and $400 per night (corporate rate) and with the Pensione costing $120 per night it's important to keep that in perspective. The Good Things 1. The cost - $120 per night for a deluxe room in Sydney is pretty good 2. The location is very good for getting around. Buses, trains and light rail all on your doorstep 3. It has a guest kitchen and laundry (good for longer stays) 4. The tea, coffee and guest soaps were good quality (not the dodgy cheap hotel stuff) 5. The room was modern, clean and air conditioned (Daiken - which is very quiet) The Bad Things 1. If you are in a room on George Street, it is very noisy 2. If you are hoping to see the Sydney icons from your bedroom window, you will be disappointed 3. The rooms are VERY small. They were fine for us as we travel light, but those who travel with massive suitcases will find it very tight 4. The TV is too high and you can't watch it without getting a sore neck Conclusion If you are a first time visitor to Sydney and have visions of seeing the opera house, harbour bridge and bondi beach from your hotel (or nearby) this is NOT the place for you. This end of Sydney is NOT what you see in the tourist brochures. Spend the extra money and stay closer to Circular Quay. However, If you are happy to use the transport system, want a good, private room for a good price then consider the Pensione. If I was travelling to Sydney for a holiday I would consider staying there again. I would definitely be asking for a room away from George Street though!

Reviews.Title: “Read Before You Book !”
Reviews.Author: Oskar07
Reviews.Content: The web-site for this 'boutique hotel' in Sydney looked inviting so my husband and I booked two nights. Take this advice....It has seriously deteriorated since last reviews posted as we found it (Room 210) to be no more than a back-packers doss house. Stained, threadbare carpet; grubby walls; dirty light-switch plates; no headboards or bed-side lights; thin pillows with no innner covers; filthy dirty TV screen; half-defrosted fridge; filthy windows overlooking extremely noisy George St.;( this Haymarket end of George St. is very grubby and seedy) rubbish, dust and torn lining under the beds; cracked glass in wall pictures; had to pay for lockers to leave our luggage. We took photographs, checked out first thing next morning ( they reluctantly refunded one night's payment) and moved to the Philip St. Travelodge which was ten times better and about the same price. I am going to report The Pensione to the Australian Tourist Board as it should carry a health warning! In fact we mentioned it to the Visitor Information in The Rocks ..... they had had similar complaints so had removed it from their lists.You have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Skip it (unless you're a backpacker)”
Reviews.Author: oliveanne
Reviews.Content: I wish we would have listened to the other reviews but we thought we could tough it out. Only stayed for 1 night (which was always the plan) and we were glad we didn't book for any longer. Starting at the begining- the receptionist was anything but welcoming and friendly. It was a total bother that our presence meant she had to do her job (I think she had been reading or filing her nails or something unimportant). The room was ok, it was small but that's really not a problem. It's truly no frills (no extra blanket or pillow). The biggest annoyance was the bathroom sink, which (i kid you not) was about 4"x6". Brushing teeth became an aquatic activity. It really is a nicely (although sparsely) furnished backpacker hotel. So unless you're 18 and hiking your way through Oz, I'd skip this one. Although, I will say the location is good- right on the bus line and walking distance to many areas.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: Mysa1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Pensione Hotel, George Street Sydney. Had a room at the front (Georgestreet). Couldn't sleep because of the trafficnoise at night. Traffic goes 24/7. Slept second night slightly better because of the earplugs i had bought. Can not recommend a room at Georgestreet-side.

Reviews.Title: “An unpleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Travellingman73
Reviews.Content: l stayed at the Pensione hotel recently with my mother visiting from South Africa and she correctly likened our room to Nelson Mandelas prison cell on Roben Island. It had one small glazed over window which looked onto a landing so we could not open it and the beds were made of grey steel. The woman in reception was extremely rude and accused me of short changing her when I paid for a shuttle bus to the airport. The flashy web site is not a true reflection of the Hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieinLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pensione for one night with my partner. Given that it was a long weekend and we got a good rate, hotel was ok. It is a little bit like poking your way around a maze at times, to get to our room we had to go through a few corners, outside, more corners, lift, outside (thought we were lost as there is little signage to rooms) through a fire door to find a hallway, outside again, another hallway, then at last, our room. Rooms are small (as expected) but very clean which is all we wanted for the night. We were told we were 'upgraded'.. I think an upgraded room must simply have bunk beds as well as a double. Room was very noisy at night, we got in at about 1am and it was a saturday night, windows could use some glazing. However, after a while I did sleep quite soundly (or was that the 6 champagnes I had?) either way, it was a little less than expected I must say, but the staff were helpful and friendly. I had been told the room would be read at 12 when I booked, arrived early after a long drive at 11.30 hoping it would be ready but was happy to wait. We were told that the room could be done within 15 minutes... half an hour later we were told it would be done before two but could put our things in the room whilst the cleaner was there. She knew nothing of us leaving our things, told us they would be safe and would lock the door once she finished cleaning the room. We arrived after lunch, to our very clean room, with the door ajar. Wasn't happy about that. What can I say, there were two cleaners employed to work on a long weekend... However, our stay was budget, which was all we were after. Next time though, Id say we will back at the Sofitel. Ps... the elevator was still out of order...

Reviews.Title: “stuck in lift”
Reviews.Author: dreamtraveller39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pensione, room was okay but lift spoilt our stay. The lift was on the blink and we were not told not to use it. The morning of our check out we got stuck in the lift for over an hour and as a result missed our flight. Cost us an additional $580 to get home. The manager wipped his hands of us and blamed everyone else. Offered no compensation and kept passing the resonsibility on. They took our money, so they should of been responsible. Very disappointed with the lack of assisstance, stay at your own peril.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelCork
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel for the price. The room was large and very clean and the bathroom was recently redone. It is located within walking distance of china town and the Irish market. It was also very central located (about 20 minutes walk) from the opera house, bus station, quays. There were multiple bus routes available directly outside the hotel door as well.

Reviews.Title: “Room was never cleaned but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WinKz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pensione for 5D4Ns in late April, 2007. We checked into a deluxe room with no problem; check-in & -out process was quick and easy. I was warned the rooms were small, but found that it was surprisingly spacious, with a closet & a bedside lamp (which I was told made the difference between standard & deluxe). Bathroom was indeed on the small side, with the tiniest wash basin i've ever seen... Oh, I don't understand why they can't put up more towel racks or shelves... The biggest problem was that they did NOT clean the room in the 5 days we stayed there. The bed was made, fresh towels provided, but we noticed the bedsheets were not changed and bathroom was not cleaned. This made us think the room was probably never cleaned too. And that made the stay felt very 'dirty'. And this was after we politely reminded the cleaning service lady to clean our room every morning before we left the hotel... Location: Purrfect! It's great, just off Chinatown, easy walk to QVB... We walked from the hotel to Circular Quay, took about 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance and Service”
Reviews.Author: RosalieSydney
Reviews.Content: What it promised it delivered. Old world architecture, comfortable room, excellent service, close to all amenities and excellent price. We had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced backpackers rather than boutique”
Reviews.Author: radames
Reviews.Content: I checked in to Pensione and checked straight out again! The "deluxe" room was cramped and dirty. You can ask to have a stained blanket and worn linen changed but ii says something about standards overall. I'm not sure just how bad a standard room would be - maybe a hammock and a hole in the floor? The guest lounge was full of smokers and you have to pay to store your bag until your room is ready. Its not the standard I would expect for the price. However when I offered to pay more (than $A160) for a room more like the photo on the website the receptionist apologised, saying all the rooms were small and those photos were misleading. She indicated that there had been other complaints. And if you change your mind once you see just what poor value it is, you'll be stung a nights acommodation as a cancellation fee. Don't risk it - you can do much better in Sydney for a much lower price - try the Vulcan instead - just up the road, heritage facade, attractive large rooms for $110 and charming staff. They rescued my stay in Sydney for me!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Laceytreigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pensione late in 2006 for 2 nights on a quick getaway. The location is excellent, so close to Chinatown and all the great food! Also very handy to the Capitol Theatre, Sydney Entertainment Centre and Paddy's Markets. We felt safe walking around after dark. Our room was small, but adequate, although next time we will request a room which doesn't face George St (the main road). We didn't spend a lot of time in our room, so it wasn't important. We had a lovely breakfast at a 24 hour cafe on the next corner. The common room was large and had cooking facilities. Luggage storage lockers were handy, but the biggest sizes were in most demand and some people seemed to have problems getting one in the size they needed. The staff were very friendly and there were lots of brochures for things to see and do. .

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring but good location”
Reviews.Author: daveybuk
Reviews.Content: If you can get a good price (we paid 115 dollars per night for our three night stay), this hotel is a decent option if your priority is a central location. However, at the rack rates avoid like the plague. Sydney's shops are right on the doorstep making this a very conveniently-located hotel. However, it does not feel like the safest area late at night (the neighbouring bottle shop employs a 'Safety Officer'). Our room was tiny, but clean, modern and air-conditioned. It's a mystery though how it could be described as 'deluxe' - perhaps because it had a bedside lamp? Standard rooms presumably just have a bed and bucket. With its grey corridors and rather functional feel the building does have the air of a good quality backpackers. If you're out and about all the time, then it's a fine choice for location and cleanliness alone. If you value the hotel 'experience' as important to your break, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket backpackers”
Reviews.Author: Julianna23
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Pensione hotel in Sydney for four nights in late august. We had a deluxe room which included tea/coffee facilities. Rooms are very small, but clean. The hotel is right next to Chinatown, which I was a bit wary about at first but liked the area and felt safe there coming back to the hotel after 10. The staff were nice and helpful and I found the atmosphere at the hotel friendly. It did feel more like an upmarket backpackers, especially with the bunk beds that were in our room. The common room is nice and modern, and we ended up going there a few times to use the internet over our stay and the lockers for our luggage on our check out day (fees apply for both services). The monorail and light rail are just around the corner and there's a bus stop out the front of the hotel, so that was good. I would recommend this hotel if your on a budget and want to be close to the city and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: tomcricket
Reviews.Content: On arrival i was greeted by friendly staff who took their time to explain the hotel facilities and help me plan my trip in Sydney. The room was very small (even for a single room). However, it was spotless and the bed was pretty comfortable. I booked the Pensione hotel because of its price and location - and i wasn't dissapointed! All of the city was in easy walking distance and for the price i paid i couldn't have asked for better. I would recommend this to young travellers who want a clean, cheap and centrally located hotel but don't worry to much about luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't be my first choice”
Reviews.Author: vennaj
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small and are quite noisy (we were at the back of the hotel too) Didnt feel that safe coming and going from the hotel at night, would've have been better to haved stayed somewhere closer in for a few extra dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i decided that we were going to take a holiday to Sydeny before the birth of our first child. We went to our Travel Agent and they did the whole booking for us we only had to choose the hotel that we wanted to stay in. They showed us a broucher on the Pensione Hotel and we thought that it was the perfect. We arrived at the hotel around 12.30pm. We were able to go strait in to our room, this was great as we were told check in was 2.00pm. The rooms were simple and clean,the bathroom had large shower. When it came to finding great places to eat the staff were the people to talk to, they told us all about the great places in sydeny. They arrange Tours to the blue Mountains and even gave us free drink voucher for the bar down stairs. I Just wanted to say thanks to everyone for making our visit to Sydney a one to remeber

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: muzgetz
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the whole. Rooms are a little small but clean. Simple and nice. No frills. Location good but need to walk a bit to the train stations. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located, great value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pensione for a week recently, choosing it because because it could accomodate me and my family when a lot hotels in the city just don't have the rooms to sleep a couple and 3 children, and the kids loved climbing into bunks each night! Another major factor in choosing the hotel was the price, was really suprised to find out that I could get a room for all 5 of us for about 90 pounds a night, such good value for sydney, in fact I struggled to find anything as reasonable anywhere else on our trip. Unfortunately, we arrived in Sydney aparently during some of the worst weather they had had in years. Luckily the people on the reception were always very helpful in giving us lots of suggestions on places to visit on rainy days, and plenty for when the sun came back out too. I really liked the the layout of the rooms and hotel in general, the hotel looks old from the outside but inside the rooms are all newly refurbished and had all the facilities we needed. There was also some nice communal areas where we were able to make some lunch and surf the net. I really liked the old staircase that descended into a shopping arcade and down into chinatown, we thought the location was great, darling harbour with it's quality aquarium so close and only 25 mins walk to the Opera House was not even far for our 4year old!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - NIce feel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is hard to remember the last time I felt compelled to actually write something good down about a business - usually I tend to do it when I have something bad to say. This hotel has the best service I have encountered in a long time. Whether it be giving you advice on what to see or how to get some where - ALL OF THE STAFF - are willing to offer you assistance. This was our first trip to Sydney and getting on in age I like to plan things down to the most minute detail. We constantly we at the reception desk asking questions, my wife said I was pestering the staff but not once did I get the impression that I was imposing. On arriving back into the hotel each day we were always greeted with questions about how our day was and this was a fantastic way to share our experiences. In fact the staff were so great we had to take photos to take home and show the family and put in the album as these lovely young people really did deserve to be remembered as part of our holiday. Don't worry about the hotel - its clean and central. The staff are what will make your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Nice Rooms, No probs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was slightly disappointed with this hotel after seeing their website. I think we thought that it would be luxury at a budget price. It wasn't. But it was still nice. Our room was small, and had a fridge. But I did find the fact that there wasn't bed side lamps annoying as you had to turn the big light off and get in bed in the dark! The decor is nice and the bed is quite soft with only one pillow each. I would expect the reception staff would have provided more if we had asked. We didn't have a chair, although the only thing i use a chair in hotel rooms for is to chuck my clothes on. There was a small comfy stool though. There was no wardrobe either, but we lived out of our bags. The $7 breakfast seemed a bargain from their website, but it is just a small box of cereal, a small carton of juice and some milk. I think I had in my head continental at croissants and jam and fresh bread!! We found the hotel to be a 30-35 minute walk from the rocks and 10-15 minutes from darling harbour (we walk quite quickly), but there is a bus stop right outside and nearly every bus goes to the rocks or circular quay. The area is busy at night, but we didn't find it excessively noisy. Out room was quiet and had a window although it was around a courtyard not getting much light. There was a telephone to dial directly into our room although my mum tried calling a couple of times and the line was dead. We did not investigate this any further. We arrived early around midday and our room was ready and we found the receptionist quite helpful. Our room was on the 2nd floor but there were tonnes of steps to carry our heavy bags up. There was a lift but we were impatient and it was quite slow. The bath room was really nice and tiled. Quite trendy. But it was lacking in a tooth brush holder and the shower door nearly came off of it's rails the first time i triend to use it. This was reported to reception. It didn't seem to be fixed during our stay so we just had to be careful opening and closing it. All in all a nice place, clean, comfortable and everything we could need - we only sleep in hotel rooms, there's far too much to do in sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of hiring a car when we arrived in Sydney airport. When we arrived at the hotel it became apparent that the car was going to be more of a hinderance then a help. The hotel location is perfect - it's walking distance to Darling Harbour and the CBD and for anything else there is a bus stop just outside the door. The rooms are very clean and tidy and the bathrooms are very trendy. One thing to note is that whilst the rooms are clean and comfortable they are light on the ameneties - there is a wardrobe, fridge, TV (mounted on a bracket from the roof) tea/coffee, lamp, hairdryer, air conditioning. You can tell this hotel is geared for the traveller that is not intending to spend a lot of time in the room. In saying this there is a great area towards the back of the hotel that is very open with lounges, internet, laundry and small kitchenette with all the crokery and cutlery you would need. We chose this hotel after a recommendation from a friend that stayed just after they opened some 18 months ago. For the money your asked to pay, considering this is a central Sydney hotel, I would stay again. If you are looking at this hotel then please take into account my comments on ammenties. Great if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just had a week at the Pensione Hotel Sydney, and consider it one of the nicest and frendlest hotels we have stayed at in over 20 years of travelling, the reception was excellent, service and cleanliness the same, what more can we say??? we give it 5 stars R & J Metcalfe Auckland NZ

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: freedomfortwo
Reviews.Content: I can certainly recomment this hotel. It is a beautiful old building, reminding me of old Europe, with a magnificant staircase. The hallways and rooms are very modern, comfortable and clean! We found the beds very good, friendly, helpful staff, clean towels every day if requested, coffee and tea supplies topped up. The only drawback was the street noise! You have to bring your earplugs, otherwise sleep is out of the question. But that can be expected if you book a hotel on the main drag! We had a wonderful three night stay and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hostel gives backpackers a bad name”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All was going fine with my holiday until I encountered this so called Hotel. First off this is not a hotel, this is a hostel. This fact is very obvious when you see the size of your room, the lack of facilities and the dodgy characters that hang around the common room for most of the day sleeping off hangovers. I was completely mislead by the website and I should have researched this hostel a little better. Anyway, any place that charges you to mind your bags for a few hours is always going to be dodgy. I wouldn't go back for a second helping....ever

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the Price ”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 11 days and it was OK It could do with a desk or even a chair in the room. The TV hanging from the ceiling is not too good and as there is no chair you've got to sit or lay on your bed to watch it...........but it's not too often you'll be in the room! The hotel has a great location on George St and Chinatown. I think I'd pay the extra to get a better hotel if I was returning, but it's ideal if you're on a budget and you want to see OZ. ROOM WAS KEPT CLEAN AND STAFF SEEMED TO BE OK ALTHOUGH I DIDN'T REALLY HAVE ANY RAPPORT WITH THEM. I CERTAINLY WOULDNT RUN THE PLACE DOWN AS IT IS VALUE FOR THE MONEY YOU'RE PAYING. IF YOU DO GO ENJOY AS SYDNEY IS A BEAUTIFUL PLACE

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Cartman88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in mid February. If your main concern is location then this hotel is in a great spot within a few mins walk of the following: Sydney CBD Central Station Monorail Chinatown Paddys Market Darling Harbour Star City Casino The room itself cost $100 per night and was very small and very basic - it was ok if you are just looking to crash for the night - but if you plan to spend some time in your hotel room relaxing then it is really lacking - some others have described it as not much better than a hostel which I think is an exaggeration but I can see why they say this.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really good hospitality. Friendly and charming staff. Really Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. Hotel was very clean and eveyone was wondeful.

HotelInfo.Name: Pensione Hotel Sydney - by 8Hotels
HotelInfo.Address: 631 - 635 George St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
